title: Software Engineer
description:
**Software: fuel for mobility**


We bring bold digital visions to life. So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change – one line of high-quality code at a time. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.

  


**What is in it for you?**

  


Sustainable transportation and mobility together with electrification are some of the core goals at Volvo Cars in our journey towards a more sustainable future and our goal to provide safe, sustainable, and personal travel. In line with our ambitions, we understood that our vehicles and related software ecosystem are a crucial platform to integrate third-party products and services to contribute to a more sustainable economy.

  


For such a mission at Volvo Cars, we, at the Third Party Developer Experience cluster, are looking for an engaged and self-going engineer to join us and help us build and shape our energy solutions capabilities, a brand-new area within our portfolio. You will be joining at a time where we are at the beginning of shaping and creating a high-quality ecosystem of products and services in the electrification plans of Volvo Cars.

  


Our goal is to augment the capabilities and functionality of Volvo vehicles for our customers. And we do this collaborating with other teams in the organization to enable internal and external makers, develop APIs, and support the rollout of portals and documentation. We are a culturally- and gender-diverse team of engineers and product managers, with varied backgrounds in computer science, informatics, and electronics, focused on solving problems rather than just talking about them.

  

  

Our portfolio includes APIs, emulators, documentation and open data, and our well-known safety research database. We are also eager to highlight our expertise and ideas and participate in internal hackathons as well as external competitions - sometimes, getting an award. This position is primarily located in our offices in Stockholm, Sweden but we work in a hybrid mode and in collaboration with our offices in Gothenburg, Sweden and Mahwah, NJ, USA.

  

  

**What will you be doing?**

  


* Put yourself in the shoes of a front-end software engineer and assess the design, implementation, and deployment needs of a third-party and partner-facing system to create end-to-end developer experiences.
* Be part of the Volvo Cars Third Party Developer Experience cluster and together with your colleagues and peers you will enable a first-class API platform developer portal in the cloud.
* Lead and support the development and deployment of regional adaptations of the products and services within the Third Party Developer Experience cloud platform.
* Participate in design and development tasks, assist your peers with operational and implementation issues. Be eager to communicate your findings and learnings.
* Work with modern software principles and welcome exploring, trying, and testing new technologies.

  

  

**Who are you?**

  


* You have either a university degree in some STEM discipline (e.g., computer science, mathematics, information technology or electrical engineering) or equivalent demonstrable practical experience.
* You have some years of experience as a seasoned software engineer in an agile environment and are proficient in at least one modern programming language (e.g., Go, JavaScript or Python).
* You have hands-on experience with applications in cloud-native platforms, preferably Amazon Web Services or Microsoft Azure.
* You are passionate about front-end development with a few years of professional experience, particularly in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, React.js, Typescript, and Next.js frameworks.
* You are skilled in building accessible and performant websites and have experience with CI/CD tools.
* You have a strong understanding of Service Oriented Architectures and care about end-to-end developer experience, guiding other developers to improve their products and services.
* (Optional) You know API communication protocols and frameworks, such as GraphQL, gRPC, REST, or webhooks and enjoy building scalable, performant, reliable and highly available services.

  

  

**How are you?**

  


* You enjoy collaborating effectively with engineering, product and UX (User eXperience) to break down technical requirements and build innovative solutions.
* You understand and advocate for the importance of having scalable, sustainable, and architecturally sound solutions.
* You enjoy tackling interesting problems and you like following them through to the end.
* You comfortably navigate ambiguity and when required can exercise good judgment and decision-making.
* You demonstrate and champion appetite for knowledge. You enjoy developing yourself strive to grow as a practitioner while effectively communicate your findings to your peers.
* You have a strong commitment to a healthy balance between work and personal life.

  


**We offer our employees excellent benefits such as:**

  


* Plenty of leave to let you take time off for what’s most important in life.
* Collective Agreement and ITP pensions.
* An annual allowance to be spent on your health and wellbeing.

  





**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  



  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Join us on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
  

  

Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more here  

Curious about our story? Read more here
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Business Expert
description:
**Company Description** **Do you want to work with a key value driver for our customers? Are you an active connector with a keen interest in people and building relations? Are you passionate about AI and being a driving force in bringing business and tech together for the optimal user experience and maximized business value?**

**Then this might be your next adventure! Come join our vibrant and forward-thinking team as a Business Expert in the In & Post Season Inventory Management value stream, based in the Merchandising unit within Sales.**

Sales is a global function within the H&M brand with the mission of growing and engaging our customer base, as well as growing and developing our sales channels. By holding the responsibility for our regions and bringing together expertise from both business and digital & tech perspectives, Sales play's a key role in delivering on our brand plan - to elevate H&M through product, experience, and brand providing aspirational fashion at an unbeatable price.  

  

As Business Expert, you will be working with two product teams that are together shaping the future of price optimization omnichannel through development and implementation of AI technologies and the user experience around it. Pricing Insights & Recommendation product team is focused on machine learning and AI, Price Adjustment Experience product team is focused on the in-tool user experience.

 **Job Description**  

As a Business Expert in our two product teams, you are accountable for making sure the products meet end user needs, both in the digital and retail channels, and bring value to the business. Our products support merchandisers in our sales regions in the whole H&M Group on a global scale. Alongside our current Business Expert, you will work closely with product managers, engineers, data scientists, UX designers, stake holders and end users, focusing on pinpointing and prioritize wanted effects for the products and how these can be realized to create business value.


As a Business Expertyou are the link between sales and tech. You will identify improvement needs and potentials and find business opportunities which will contribute to exceed the user expectations. You are passionate in taking part in our development and loves to be in the center of the action where the products meet business. To make a difference for our regions and markets you need to be able to transform this into tangible actions in a keep it simple way. Together with the teams you will find smart processes and tools to support the mission in a successful way.


Furthermore, you will:

* Have one leg in the subject matter expertise perspective (sales & merchandising), and one in the tech perspective, finding synergies and bridge the two product teams.
* Have deep understanding of the current pricing processes as well as the potentials for the future and are responsible for defining needs through a tight collaboration with users and stakeholders in many parts of the organization, to support & make sure that we are maximizing our business outcome.
* Work closely with end users to understand and document business requirements. Translate business needs into clear and concise technical requirements that the development team can use. Take a holistic perspective to the business problem, challenge status quo and the users in identifying the real problem in order to find the right solution.
* Work closely with the developers to anchor the business perspective during all phases of the tech development. You will participate & drive the business agenda in team meetings related to e.g. price elasticity, demand forecast features & granularity, optimization constraints, replenishment functionality, in-tool user experience, etc.
* Be responsible to support merchandisers hands-on during price reduction activities, being the point of contact for the regions and proactively securing a smooth experience for them.
* Be responsible for making sure that the product meets value by taking on the change management perspective in relation to end users and other stakeholders, including training and making sure new features are being well-received while driving engagement and motivation among end users.
* Actively identify new stakeholders in a constantly changing environment

  

**Qualifications**  

As a Business Expert you will be a key driver in these two teams; therefore, we think you have interest in pricing, user experience and technology. You are a communicative team player with great presentation skills. You are strategic and fast in understanding and execution. Our products’ scope and potential constantly grow and we believe that you are driven by seizing this opportunity to shape the future for reductions and prices.


Furthermore, you:

* Have previous experience within H&M merchandising, business controlling, supply chain or similar area. Experience in working with retail is a plus
* Excel at stake holder management
* Have experience with tool- and/or method development
* Are a connector and collaborator, positive and energetic, and you actively build trust and relationships at all levels
* Are a solution-focused “do-er”, willing to get hands-on, solving any problems needed to make the team move forward
* Are self-driven, flexible and independent

  

**Additional Information**  

This is a full-time position within Swede. If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your CV in English as soon as possibleno later than 19th of August,


At H&M Group we strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process that is why we kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases


We look forward to your application!!

*H&M Group is a* *value-driven company* *that is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.*

title: Software System Architect for Digital Development
description:
Do you want to save lives? At Autoliv, we believe that no one should have to be seriously injured or lose their life in a traffic accident. Every day we strive for this conviction by developing and manufacturing innovative products of superior quality. Because when people can feel safe while they are traveling, they can also live life to the fullest. We believe in cooperation and therefore we work closely with our customers and suppliers. Our teams are cross-functional and work according to agile principles in a global context.
  
We are expanding our team within our Global Innovation Center in Vårgårda / Gothenburg and are looking for an experienced software system architect.
  
About the role
  
As a Software System Architect you will work with a small team building the next generation digital products from Autoliv. This is a part of a journey towards a data-driven future, where the software system architect role is an opportunity to not only lead a team developing next generation products, but also an opportunity to help scale and transform an organization. The job involves directing a development team, as well as interacting with both internal and external stakeholders while continuously looking for synergies and reuse of existing software assets.
  
You will work in a small team responsible for building a toolbox of software components to quickly industrialize ideas. The team will own the bootstrapping of projects, as well as building the frameworks that will be used to accelerate the time from a prototype to a product in the hands of a user.
  
The team will be a central part in the digital strategy in the global context that is Autoliv. You will work in an international team together with teams from all over the world.
  
You will work with the seed from which Autoliv will establish an end-to-end software architecture from embedded devices, apps all the way to cloud systems. Parts of the stack are affected by functional safety requirements, while others are pure web software where UX is of essence. Throughout machine learning is deployed to analyze the data collected.
  
Keywords
  
Technical leadership experience
  
Experience of agile software development
  
Knowledge of Embedded Systems development
  
Knowledge of Embedded Linux
  
Knowledge of Cloud infrastructure
  
Knowledge of DevOps and CI/CD
  
Knowledge of C/C++
  
Knowledge of embedded machine learning solutions
  
Knowledge of cloud side machine learning solutions
  
Experience from requirements tracking
  
Experience from functional safety, e.g. ISO26262
  
Technical end-to-end understanding of software systems and/or machine learning
  
  

Bonus Skills
  
Experience from cyber security, e.g. ISO21434
  
Knowledge of AUTOSAR
  
Knowledge of Matlab Simulink or other model based development approaches
  
  

About you
  
We are looking for a person who enjoys working between scientific research and the bleeding edge of technology, but with a product mindset. You are excited about putting the latest and greatest into the hands of users and help doing so by aligning the restrictions from products with the opportunities from research.
  
About us
  
Being the world’s leading automotive safety supplier requires brave decisions, innovation, a focus on technology and customers – and people with a passion for saving lives.
  
Autoliv's vision of Saving More Lives guides our daily work. Life can change in a fraction of a second – and we have developed automotive safety systems with that moment in mind for over six decades. Each year, our products save more than 30,000 lives, products that must operate perfectly in milliseconds.
  
We have 65 000 employees in 27 countries. Our mission is to provide world class life saving solutions for mobility and society. We develop, manufacture and sell safety systems for automotive such as airbags, seatbelts, steering wheels and pedestrian protection systems for today and tomorrows vehicles. With a high level of competence we work to create safety for road users, quality for our customers, trust and security for our employees, stability and growth for our shareholders, as well as sustainable methods and working methods.
  
In Sweden we host the company´s Global Innovation Center, located in Vårgarda / Gothenburg. Our focus in on developing new and existing products, both in our core areas such as airbags and seatbelts but also in the Mobility Safety Solutions area. We do this in cross functional teams and in close cooperation with Research who is also located on site. We have unique testing and prototype facilities.
  
Our offer
  
You will be part of a successful and exciting global company with good development opportunities. We offer technical career development and the opportunity to work in cross-functional agile project teams with exciting and innovative products in a global context.
  
Practical information
  
**Place of Work:** Gothenburg / Vårgårda
  
**Way of working:** a mix between home office and work form the office.
  
**Scope:** Full-time
  
**Employment type:** Permanent
  
**Start date:** According to agreement.
  
Questions
  
Questions about the position is answered by Johanna Högemark, Department Manager Innovation and Human Factors, johanna.hogemark@autoliv.com.
  
Collective agreement
  
We have collective agreement with Sveriges Ingenjörer/Unionen/Ledarna and IF Metall. Union representatives can be reached via the company switchboard, + 46 322 62 62 00.
  
Application
  
Welcome with your application no later than 2024-07-18 in the form of a CV and personal letter. As part of the recruitment process, candidates who go further will need to prove their CV with a copy of diploma, certificate / grade.

title: Jobba med mobilen - starta idag
description:
JOBBA VIA DIN MOBIL/DATOR

title: Graphic Artist
description:
We're looking for a gifted artist who loves to draw, paint, compose, animate and explore the possibilities to push the look and feel of casino games to a new level. Your main job will be to create beautiful things. Those things are: backgrounds, characters, symbols and whatever you feel will add character and feeling to the game at hand.
   

  

 We want a perfectionist that is not afraid to get down and dirty with new styles that might not be what she/he is usually comfortable with, to be able to get a more diverse look throughout our portfolio. You will be an important part of the team, already from the early process of the project, sketching and exploring the game design close together with your team. Hence you have great conceptual skills and understand the difference of early stage “sketch-spouting” and final polish and render.
   

  

 You're not a drone. Your ideas matter. Meaning, you will be a part of a creative process that is creating a game together with skilled individuals from the Nolimit game team.
   

  

**Job Description**
* Strong visual skills and understanding of composition, anatomy color, light and shape
* Master diverse set of styles
* Dominion over PS, AI, AE and similar software. Z-brush sculpting is a plus
* Story boarding, animatics and scene composing is a plus


 Who you are
   

  

* You have the skills required and a vast imagination that is always ready for a challenge
* You have a an understanding of the game production process. Such as sketching for concepts and mockups as well as following the artistic vision for set project
* You take pride in delivering quality art. But not afraid to scrap a non-fulfilling delivery if the game benefits from it
* You are passionate about working in an environment of continuous learning


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta, Romania and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Business Expert
description:
**Company Description**
**Do you want to work with a key value driver for our customers? Are you an active connector with a keen interest in people and building relations? Are you passionate about AI and being a driving force in bringing business and tech together for the optimal user experience and maximized business value?**
**Then this might be your next adventure! Come join our vibrant and forward-thinking team as a Business Expert in the In & Post Season Inventory Management value stream, based in the Merchandising unit within Sales.**
 Sales is a global function within the H&M brand with the mission of growing and engaging our customer base, as well as growing and developing our sales channels. By holding the responsibility for our regions and bringing together expertise from both business and digital & tech perspectives, Sales play's a key role in delivering on our brand plan - to elevate H&M through product, experience, and brand providing aspirational fashion at an unbeatable price.
   

  

 As Business Expert, you will be working with two product teams that are together shaping the future of price optimization omnichannel through development and implementation of AI technologies and the user experience around it. Pricing Insights & Recommendation product team is focused on machine learning and AI, Price Adjustment Experience product team is focused on the in-tool user experience.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Business Expert in our two product teams, you are accountable for making sure the products meet end user needs, both in the digital and retail channels, and bring value to the business. Our products support merchandisers in our sales regions in the whole H&M Group on a global scale. Alongside our current Business Expert, you will work closely with product managers, engineers, data scientists, UX designers, stake holders and end users, focusing on pinpointing and prioritize wanted effects for the products and how these can be realized to create business value.
   

  

 As a Business Expert you are the link between sales and tech. You will identify improvement needs and potentials and find business opportunities which will contribute to exceed the user expectations. You are passionate in taking part in our development and loves to be in the center of the action where the products meet business. To make a difference for our regions and markets you need to be able to transform this into tangible actions in a keep it simple way. Together with the teams you will find smart processes and tools to support the mission in a successful way.
   

  

 Furthermore, you will:
   

  

* Have one leg in the subject matter expertise perspective (sales & merchandising), and one in the tech perspective, finding synergies and bridge the two product teams.
* Have deep understanding of the current pricing processes as well as the potentials for the future and are responsible for defining needs through a tight collaboration with users and stakeholders in many parts of the organization, to support & make sure that we are maximizing our business outcome.
* Work closely with end users to understand and document business requirements. Translate business needs into clear and concise technical requirements that the development team can use. Take a holistic perspective to the business problem, challenge status quo and the users in identifying the real problem in order to find the right solution.
* Work closely with the developers to anchor the business perspective during all phases of the tech development. You will participate & drive the business agenda in team meetings related to e.g. price elasticity, demand forecast features & granularity, optimization constraints, replenishment functionality, in-tool user experience, etc.
* Be responsible to support merchandisers hands-on during price reduction activities, being the point of contact for the regions and proactively securing a smooth experience for them.
* Be responsible for making sure that the product meets value by taking on the change management perspective in relation to end users and other stakeholders, including training and making sure new features are being well-received while driving engagement and motivation among end users.
* Actively identify new stakeholders in a constantly changing environment


**Qualifications**
 As a Business Expert you will be a key driver in these two teams; therefore, we think you have interest in pricing, user experience and technology. You are a communicative team player with great presentation skills. You are strategic and fast in understanding and execution. Our products’ scope and potential constantly grow and we believe that you are driven by seizing this opportunity to shape the future for reductions and prices.
   

  

 Furthermore, you:
   

  

* Have previous experience within H&M merchandising, business controlling, supply chain or similar area. Experience in working with retail is a plus
* Excel at stake holder management
* Have experience with tool- and/or method development
* Are a connector and collaborator, positive and energetic, and you actively build trust and relationships at all levels
* Are a solution-focused “do-er”, willing to get hands-on, solving any problems needed to make the team move forward
* Are self-driven, flexible and independent


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time position within Swede. If you feel that your experience, skills and ambitions are right for this role, please send your CV in English as soon as possible no later than 19th of August,
   

  

 At H&M Group we strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process that is why we kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases
   

  

 We look forward to your application!!
   

  

*H&M Group is a* 
*value-driven company* 
*that is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age.*

title: Junior produktägare inom e-handel till Gårdssällskapet!
description:
Gårdssällskapet startades 2013 för att hjälpa matälskare att få ekologiskt kött direkt från gården hem till dörren. Alla våra bönder värnar om djurens välmående och vi tycker att man ska ta vara på det fina arbete de lägger ner och vad de producerar. Hela verksamheten genomsyras av personlig service och kvalitet och produkterna är ekologiskt, småskaligt eller vilt producerade. Gårdssällskapet köper direkt från den ekologiska gården, styckar i egen regi innan vi levererar ut till konsument. Majoriteten av vår försäljning kommer genom prenumeration av Stamkundslådan och e-handelsplattformen är vår viktigaste kanal för försäljning. I och med den tillväxtresa vi befinner sig i får du verkligen möjligheten att påverka och göra skillnad! Låter det som något för dig? Läs vidare!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Gårdssällskapet AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Gårdssällskapets e-handel bär en central del i försäljningen och det är av stor vikt att den hela tiden utvecklas för att möta kundernas behov och förväntningar. Du kommer att arbeta tätt tillsammans med din närmaste chef, Martina Uhrstedt, Head of Sales, och CRM Manager. Utöver det kommer du framför allt att samarbeta nära IT och marknad. Du kommer dels vara ansvarig för att kravställa olika utvecklingsärenden men också diskutera idéer om hur ni kan förbättra e-handelsplattformen ur både ett tekniskt och grafiskt perspektiv. På huvudkontoret i Lilla Frösunda Herrgård arbetar idag runt 20 personer, hela bolaget har runt 32 anställda.
 


  


  

**Några ord från din framtida närmsta chef**



  


 " Hej! Jag heter Martina och är säljchef på Gårdssällskapet. Under min korta tid här har jag varit med och förverkligat spännande projekt i en öppen och familjär atmosfär som betytt mycket för våra kunder och för vår försäljning. Som chef vill jag ge dig samma möjlighet att driva på inom ditt arbetsområde och få ett kvitto på det du gör. Gillar du att blanda arbetsdagen med systemtekniska e-handelslösningar och administrativt jobb med en e-handel för att möta säljmål? Vill du jobba med en produkt och ett varumärke du kan stå för – ekologiskt och småskaligt? Då kommer du att stortrivas hos oss! Som produktägare ansvarar du för kravställning av nya utvecklingar och våra tekniska kopplingar som berör e-handeln. Du säkerställer att våra produkter presenteras på bästa sätt online och analyserar försäljningsdata för handlingsbara åtgärder. Jag ser fram emot att träffa dig!
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Arbete i ett bolag som satsar på att växa, detta ger dig möjlighet att inte bara jobba med förvaltning utan också bidra med nya idéer
  
* En möjlighet att påverka dina roll och bidra med dina kunskaper
  
* Arbete i ett dynamiskt och personligt bolag
  
* Tjänstepension, 5000 kr i friskvårdsbidrag, förmånligt pris på Gårdssällskapets produkter, dator & telefon m.m.
  


  


  

**Arbetsuppgifter**



  


 Du kommer att arbeta i en bred roll med allt från att hantera produkter i e-handeln, ta fram och analysera försäljningssiffror och ge förslag på förbättring inom sortimentet/kunderbjudandet samt planerar och utvecklar hemsidan proaktivt. Fokuset är framförallt att jobba med e-handeln och systemen ur ett tekniskt perspektiv där du har systemansvar för analysverktyg som GA4, Tag Manager, Merchant Center m.m. Du ansvarar även för att säkerställa att hemsidan möter branschstandarder för e-handel, arbetar med de tekniska lösningarna och lyfter förbättringsområden. Du kommer vara den personen som projektleder och agerar kravställare i olika utvecklingsärenden och assisterar övriga team vid beställningar av IT-lösningar samt testar funktioner i kundresan efter releaser. Utöver det är du även drivandei projekt inom CRO, SEO, UX och kundlojalitet m.m.
 


  


 Vidare kommer du exempelvis…
 


  

  
* Säkerställa efterlevnad av gällande regler och best practice för en e-handel
  
* Ansvara för arbetsflödet med produkter (Trello “Produkter”), samt ansvar för löpande hantering i M2 av Lådor, TBn och Tillval.
  
* Löpande rapportering av försäljningsstatistik och ansvar för uppsättning av dashboards i Looker Studio
  
* Uppdatera hemsidans innehåll som inte faller hos Marknad eller Kundservice (skapa landningssidor, m.fl.)
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**

 I denna rekrytering kommer vi lägga stor vikt vid dig som person och ditt intresse för tjänsten och Gårdssällskapet som företag. Vi söker dig som är en lagspelare och som vill jobba brett, du är självgående och trivs i en säljdriven organisation och har ett stort intresse för att samarbeta med såväl IT som marknad för att nå de bästa lösningarna tillsammans. Vi ser även att du är flexibel och har en förmåga att anpassa dig efter nya förutsättningar och är proaktiv i ditt problemlösande.
 


  


 Utöver det har du…
 


  

  
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom e-handel där du arbetat med liknande arbetsuppgifter (ex. varit systemansvarig)
  
* Har kunskaper inom SEO och är van att agera kravställare gentemot IT
  
* Har vana av att hantera och analysera försäljningsdata
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska då det är det primära arbetsspråket
  


  


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du har…
 


  

  
* Kunskaper inom Magento, GA4, Looker Studio, SQL
  


  


  

**Övrigt information**



  

  
* Start: enligt överenskommelse
  
* Omfattning: heltid
  
* Placering: Solna, möjlighet till remotearbete ett par dagar i veckan
  
* Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och alla frågor kring processen hanteras av Academic Work.
  
* Kontaktuppgifter: Ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se samt rekryteringskoordinator Minna Loosaar, minna.loosaar@academicwork.se
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Gårdssällskapet AB**

 Läs mer om Gårdssällskapet på deras hemsida: https://www.gardssallskapet.se/
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Gårdssällskapet AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Johanna Sörell eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn05@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104938

title: BI utvecklare med erfarenhet till Qontrol
description:
Vill du vara en del av ett företag som inte bara bygger verktyg för sina kunder, utan också skapar en skillnad i deras arbetsliv? Vi söker passionerade BI-konsulter som brinner för att omvandla data till användbara insikter och beslutsunderlag. Hos Qontrol är du inte bara en konsult, du är en expert som strävar efter att bli bäst på verktyg som PowerBI och vill göra livet enklare för våra kunder. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Qontrol BI AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Qontrol erbjuder beslutsstödslösningar och användarvänliga lösningar som möjliggör försäljning, resultatuppföljning och kundvård till deras kunder. Genom att erbjuda lösningar som tar bort komplexitet och ersätter den med smarta tjänster, strävar Qontrol efter att hjälpa företagsledare att fokusera mer på kärnverksamheten och mindre på administration. Deras mål är att göra det enklare för kunderna att driva sina verksamheter och uppnå framgång.
 


  


 I rollen som Business Intelligence Utvecklare kommer du att ta emot kravställning från kunder och översätta det till en slutgiltig produkt. Du kommer, i rollen som konsult, att i vissa projekt arbeta ute hos kund för att finnas tillgänglig för frågor. Du kommer dessutom att agera mentor till de mindre erfarna i gruppen och hålla utbildningar internt.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö där vi prioriterar trivsel och engagemang.
  
* Möjlighet att arbeta med spännande utvecklingsprojekt och bli expert inom området.
  
* Kontinuerlig utveckling och möjlighet att växa inom företaget.
  
* En chans att göra verklig skillnad för våra kunder och deras affärer.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Arbeta med att förstå och översätta kundens behov till färdiga produkter och prototyper
  
* Användning av bland annat SQL för att bearbeta och förfina data till användbara insikter
  
* Skapande av datamodeller och grafiska gränssnitt för att underlätta kundens analysprocess
  
* Bygga och vårda starka relationer med kunder för att förstå deras behov och sträva efter att överträffa deras förväntningar
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en teknisk universitets- eller högskoleutbildning motsvarande minst högskoleingenjör, fördelaktigt om du är utbildad civilingenjör
  
* Har gått kurser inom Databaser och SQL
  
* Har ett års erfarenhet av att arbeta som utvecklare med Power BI. Förtydliga gärna detta i ditt CV.
  
* Har kunskap om informations-/datamodellering
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både muntligt och skriftligt
  
* Har goda kunskaper i engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Har arbetat som konsult tidigare
  
* Har gått kurser inom informations-/datavisualisering, användarvänlighet/UX, programmering, statistik och webbutveckling
  
* Har kunskaper inom Microsofts stack
  
* Har erfarenhet av andra BI-verktyg
  
* Har erfarenhet av data warehouse
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Självgående
  
* Kommunikativ
  
* Relationsskapande
  
* Strukturerad
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och Qontrols önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Qontrol BI AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Ilknur Kaya eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stw07@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15104457

title: Yrkesstolt nätverkstekniker
description:
VAERNA OT ITAB (fd. Shaya Solutions, domäner under uppdatering)är ett nischat konsultbolag inom OT/IT Säkerhet och styrsystem ochsom fokuserar på att anställaseniora personer. Med senior syftar vi på personer med djup kompetens och med lång erfarenhet. Personer som brinner för att lösa de mest komplexa problemställningarna och som är kvar till slutet av projekt.
  
Vi löser det som få kan lösa. Kunderna vill alltid ha oss pga. vår yrkesstolthet där vi brinner för att lösa våra kunders utmaningar. Inte för att vi måste, utan för att kunskapsutvecklingen driver oss som team.Det gör också att vi mer aktivt kan välja våra uppdrag och de kunder som uppskattar oss och vill ha oss på sin site och i sin organisation.
  
En inspirerande arbetsmiljö för professionell tillväxt och personlig utveckling blir då en naturlig del. Med vår breda expertis inom olika områden kan vi också stötta varandra inom teamet, så man känner sig trygg på sitt uppdrag.
  
Att interna administrationen och allt som berör den löpande kontakten med kunden avseende kontrakten, beställningar och ekonomin är inget annat än en självklarhet för oss.
  
Varför ska du söka just till oss utöver själva rollen om du söker anställning?
  
Läs gärna 'Om oss' här; https://www.shayasolutions.com/om-oss
  
Vi söker främst personer som vill ta anställning.
  
Jobbet
  
Vi har flera kunder och leverantörer som vill att vi deltar i olika projekt.
  
en av kunderna har ettdatacenternätverk och behöver en extra resurs inom nätverk. Projektet/Kunden söker en expert inom routing, DMZ, brandväggar och accessnät för att komplettera befintliga resurser och säkerställa bemanning i flera utvecklingsprojekt inom nätverk. Personen är med fördel bekant med nätverksprodukter från Cisco och Palo Alto.
  
  

**Obligatoriska kompetenser och erfarenhet:**  

Hög kompetensinom datacenternätverk och Accessnät
  
Minst 2 års erfarenhet av datacenternätverk och dess komponenter
  
Mycket goda kunskaper i nätverkskomponenter från Cisco
  
  

**Meriterande kompetenser och erfarenhet:**  

Meriterande med erfarenhet av Cisco SDA
  
Meriterande med kunskaper av brandvägg från Palo Alto
  
Meriterande med kunskaper av Infoblox DNS/DHCP
  
Meriterande med kunskaper av VMWare NSX-T
  
  

\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
  
Hur du kommer vidare
  
Sök jobbet genom denna annons
  
Lägg in ett CV i word-format
  
Vi återkopplar om något behöver kompletteras eller förtydligas.
  
  

Om VAERNA
  
Konsultbolag med nisch mot OT/IT Säkerhet och styrsystem.
  
Vi har vårt huvudkontor i centrala Stockholm och utgår normalt utifrån våra kunders site/kontor.
  
Varmt välkommen att höra av dig vid frågor eller funderingar.
  
Annonsförsäljare undanbedes.

title: Automotive Model-Based Software Engineer
description:
We are excited to expand our team with talented and passionate engineers who specialize in model-based development. As we continue to drive innovation in electrification, we invite engineers eager to shape the future of electric vehicles to join us.

  

Your responsibilities:

* Develop model-based software for automotive systems and components.
* Defining test requirements and participating in test activities.
* Possible focus areas include electromobility, vehicle dynamics, powertrain, and AD/ADAS.


In your role, you will be a part of our customers’ missions to drive the technology shift within the field of electrification. As a consultant for several of our major international clients in the Gothenburg region, the work can be done both on-site or in our in-house projects.

 **What we offer you**


At ALTEN, we believe in nurturing your passion for technology and innovation. With diverse projects across various industries, you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the world while advancing your own career. Our supportive leaders provide coaching and guidance to help you grow professionally. Additionally, you’ll have access to personalized training opportunities through our ALTEN Academy and external courses, empowering you to reach your full potential.



**Your Profile**

  

To excel in this role, we’re looking for candidates who possess:

* Experience in model-based SW development in MATLAB/Simulink.
* A minimum of 5 years of experience in the automotive electronics field.
* Professional experience with OEMs or Tier 1 suppliers.
* A BSc. and/or a MSc. in engineering.

  

Meritorious experience:

* Stateflow.
* Programming in Python.
* CANalyzer (or similar tool).
* Automotive functional safety standard ISO 26262.
* Communication protocols (CAN, LIN, Ethernet, UDS, FlexRay).


If you’re ready to take on an exciting challenge and contribute to the advancement of electromobility, apply now! Your expertise and passion are essential as we drive innovation forward together!

 **About ALTEN**


ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest consulting companies within Engineering, IT and Life Sciences with over 57,000 employees in more than 30 countries. We’re a global actor with a local presence with 1400 committed colleagues in offices from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the product development chain of the most prestigious companies in sectors such as Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Energy, Manufacturing, Public Sector and Life Sciences.

  

For four years in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden’s most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.

 ***Please note:*** *Due to summer vacations, the selection process won’t begin until 08/08/2024. Happy holidays!*


  
Jobb detaljer
08/07/2024
Göteborg
Rekrytering Kontakt
ALTEN Sweden

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Software: fuel for mobility**


We bring bold digital visions to life. So we’re on the lookout for more curious and creative engineers who want to create change – one line of high-quality code at a time. Our transformation isn't for everyone, but if you're excited about solving the leading-edge technological challenges facing the auto industry, then let’s talk about your next move.

  


**High Performance C++ Developer to Core System Application Software**

We imagine that our friends and family are transported in a personal, sustainable, and safe way. We visualize an environmentally friendly car that autonomously drives us to work or that it drives our children to school and that we can feel perfectly fine about it. What we build is a self-driving, fully electric, connected, and super safe Volvo Car. But the software architecture in our latest cars is complex. In fact, they are so complex that we cannot proceed with this platform to take the next level of an electric, autonomous, connected, and safe vehicle. Therefore, we build a new platform. The idea is that it will have a software-centric architecture, a built-in core computer that will run every application in the car. This new centralized signal system aims to enable scalable software architecture and continuous deployment, over-the-air data updates, and real-time decision-making for autonomous drive.

  

  

**About our R&D – Core System Application Software**  

Building this new software-centric platform is highly prioritized and we are facing a new stage. Our department was established to take lead in the coming challenges. Our ART is newly assigned by a team of Software Engineers with both a holistic understanding of SW architecture and a commitment to details and quality code. We are responsible for governing API and application architecture for the software in the Electric Control Units. We set deliverables, frameworks, patterns, and policies that are fundamental for other development teams to build with consensus. We also act as development support by working together with teams to succeed with development and integration.

  

  

**High Performance C++ Developers in Gothenburg**  

High performance C++ developer is not so much who you are, but rather what you will do. The High Performance chipset is what you will developing on, supporting and enabling other ART:s contribution to it. To succeed with our mission, we will need Software Developers who are able to work in an environment where not every step of development follows a clear process, but if you are willing you will together with your team and the rest of the ART, be able to set the standard for Software Development within Volvo Cars. As a developer, you need to be creative, agile and have good people skills since you will be interfacing with all other ART:s in our R&D organization, as well as the other teams within the art. We also believe that empathy, openness and sharing are key in succeeding with our mission and helps you and your agile team to grow.  



  

**Do you fit the profile?**


We see that you have a B.Sc. degree or higher in Software Engineering or equivalent experience and:


* 3+ years of C++ (or other OOP language) development in Linux environment
* Experience with test methodologies like System, Integration and Component testing,
* Experience and competence in the following tech;
	+ CI/CD tools (Git bash, Git, Gerrit, JIRA)

Meritorious competence and experience:


* Automotive experience
* SAFe experience
* ISO26262 understanding
Cyber Security knowledge  
* 

  

**Interest and application**  

We are curious if this might be the next thing for you? If you have any questions regarding the position, you are welcome to contact Hiring Manager, Peter Ankerson at peter.ankerson@volvocars.com. To apply, please register your profile at our career site and attach your application documents as soon as possible since recruitment is ongoing. Please note that applications by e-mail will not be accepted due to GDPR.

  




**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**

Volvo Cars’ success is the outcome of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  



  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Make sure you’re in the front seat on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: D365 Deployment Specialist
description:
Alfa Laval is looking for a D365 Deployment Specialist to join the Group Digital foundational area OneERP; a newly established organization to consolidate and focus all ERP related activities with clear mandates and responsibilities to create a solid and scalable transactional ERP foundation to support the strategic direction of Alfa Laval. OneERP will develop, accelerate rollouts of D365F&O and manage one common effective and efficient ERP platform based on standardization of transactional processes for all business in Alfa Laval.
And this why we are looking for YOU, our next D365 Deployment Specialist, to bring value and support in shaping OneERP’s success.
Within OneERP, we champion an open-minded and collaborative culture, where employees actively support each other. Each team member plays a pivotal role in contributing to the overall success of our organization. We firmly believe that success is attained when individuals leverage their distinct skills and perspectives while acting cohesively as a unified force driving towards common goals.
Are you ready to take on the challenge and make an impact?
About the job
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced D365 deployment specialist to become a key member of the OneERP Roll Out Project Management team. As D365 Deployment Specialist you will participate in all phases related to the rollouts - mobilization, pre-study, and realization of Microsoft D365 F&O. You will be working tightly with a dedicated roll-out team for a product group together with local project members from the business on the receiving sites. In your job, you will also have a close collaboration with Agile teams responsible for template and capability development.
Key Responsibilities:
* Providing functional training of Key Users on the manufacturing units
* Hands on system configuration, test management
* Identifying functional GAPs
* User Acceptance testing
* Supporting trainers with documentation and expertise.
* Cut-over activities
* Communicating with stakeholders in line on the overall decided structure, templates, engagement- and governance models.


What you know  

You have a bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field. You have a broad knowledge of the ERP-domain and 5+ years proven record of similar role within ERP, preferable D365 / AX 2012 on an enterprise scale. We trust you have in depth understanding and experience of business processes within Supply Chain from manufacturing companies with focus on source and plan. Presentation and communication skills are vital for this role as well as fluency in business English.
Experience in Project Management experience and/or Agile methods is a plus.
Who you are
You are an analytical and detail-oriented individual who enjoys breaking down complex problems and finding efficient solutions. You stand out with your ability to lead yourself and cooperate with others in a challenging environment while maintaining a positive attitude. We trust you are a true networker that can easily build and maintain fruitful relationships. You possess a strong business acumen and customer centric mindset which provides you with the right set skill to solve complex business requirements. You embrace change with an open mindset and continuously seek to innovate and improve solutions.
What’s in it for you?
We offer a challenging position in a global, open, and friendly environment. Your work will have a true impact on Alfa Laval’s future success. The nature of the job also means that you will cooperate closely with many different parts of our organization, building both a broad business knowledge as well as a global network of colleagues.
Assessment practicalities
We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.
For more information, please contact.
Ulf Tranesjö, Manager ERP Roll-out Project Management, ulf.tranesjo@alfalaval.com
Tanja Sukaj, Talent Acquisition Partner, tanja.sukaj@alfalaval.com
For union information, please contact:  

Johan Ranhög, Akademikerna, +46 46 2891664  

Stefan Sandell, Ledarna, +46 46 367364  

Bror Garcia Lantz, Unionen, +46 709 366985
We are reviewing applications continuously, make sure to send in yours before August 15th, 2024.
If the right candidate appears, the ad will be closed earlier.
Due to GDPR, we do not accept applications sent directly via email, they will be automatically disregarded

title: Produktägare/Produktspecialist Balanseringsstöd
description:
**Produktägare/Produktspecialist Balanseringsstöd**
===================================================


Sista ansökningsdatum: 12 augusti

Svenska kraftnät är en av de viktigaste aktörerna för en hållbar energiomställning. Till avdelningen beslutstöd inom division System söker vi nu produktägare som varje dag kommer att bidra till Sveriges elförsörjning. Vi behöver dig för att lyckas med vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige.



På division System arbetar vi på en övergripande nivå med att designa elmarknaden, utveckla och driva elsystemet. Vi är med och finner svaren på klimatomställningen och skapar välstånd för hela samhället. Vi är en nyckelspelare för att det svenska samhället ska kunna utvecklas och skapar förutsättning för att det ska fungera. Vi löser såväl dagens som morgondagens utmaningar. Vi ser till att Sverige har en lysande framtid.


**Om tjänsten**
---------------



Avdelning Beslutsstöd är länken mellan Svenska kraftnäts systemdivision och division IT. Avdelningen består idag av 6 enheter där vi nu söker en senior produktägare till enheten Balanseringsstöd.



Balanseringsstöd ansvarar för att kontrollrummets processer ges det IT stöd som situationen kräver för att hålla kraftsystemet i balans. Det innebär utveckling av applikationer för ökad automation och proaktivitet för kontrollrummet. Vi är idag en enhet bestående av 20 personer med roller som produktägare testledare och verksamhetsarkitekter. Produktområdena har ett brett spektrum av tjänster, t.ex. handelsplattformar, obalansprognostisering, hantering av realtidsdata, kapacitetshantering, samt informations- och datastyrning. Vi genomför nu en stor förändring som är nödvändiga för att kunna hantera en större andel icke-planerbar produktion i kraftsystemet samt förändrade förbrukningsmönster. Driftsäkerhet i relation till ekonomisk effektivitet är något som gör uppdraget varierat, intressant och komplext.



Ett fokusområde idag är utvecklingen av en ny Nordisk Balanseringsmodell (NBM). Idén bakom den nya balanseringsmodellen är att genom ökad automation och proaktivitet kunna hantera en större andel förnybar energi i kraftsystemet i det korta perspektivet. NBM syftar även till att möjliggöra en mer harmoniserad och effektivare handel av reserver med Europa samt leva upp till de krav som EU och tillsynsmyndigheten Energimarknadsinspektionen ställer på oss.



Vi söker nu en produktägare för produkten som stöttar processerna där kontrollrummet skapar detaljerade körplaner för Svenska Kraftnäts HVDC förbindelser. Just nu genomgår samtliga produkter kopplade till balansering en förändringsresa för att efterleva nya krav på handel av reserver som harmoniserar Europa.



I rollen som Produktägare kommer du att bygga en bred kunskap om såväl kraftsystemet, el- och balansmarknader samt inom IT-lösningar. Du kommer att samarbeta med experter både internt på Svenska kraftnät och hos andra TSO:er. Du kommer att vara den viktiga länken mellan Svenska kraftnät kärnverksamhet och IT utveckling. Du kommer även att representera Svenska kraftnät i nordiska och europeiska samarbeten där du får möjlighet att aktivt påverka förändringar på kort- och lång sikt.



Vidare innebär rollen att


* kontinuerligt definiera produkten, följa upp att produkten möter verksamhetens behov samt att produkten utvecklas i takt med verksamhetens förändrade behov på både kort och lång sikt
* ha nära kontakt med användare av produkten för att förstå deras behov och hur de ska prioriteras
* tillse att Svk’s behov prioriteras och utvecklas hos leverantören

**Om dig**
----------



Då tjänsten innebär många kontaktytor både internt och externt söker vi dig som arbetar bra med andra människor, lyssnar och kommunicerar. Du tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och strukturerar själv ditt arbetssätt samt driver dina processer framåt. Som person är du lugn och analytisk där du behåller ett realistiskt perspektiv och kan prioritera vid stressande situationer. Då rollen bland annat innebär omvärldsbevakning söker vi dig som har förmågan att se helheter utifrån verksamhetens bästa. Du arbetar även bra med komplexa frågor och kan analysera och bryta ner problem i sina beståndsdelar. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.



Vidare har du minst kandidatexamen från universitet eller högskola inom relevant område som t.ex. elkraft, energisystem, IT alternativt motsvarande utbildning/erfarenhet förvärvad på annat sätt som myndigheten anser relevant.
  

Du har:


* kandidatexamen och minst 5 års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet inom relevant område eller magisterexamen och minst 3 års aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet inom relevant område.
* minst 3 års erfarenhet av behovsanalys och kravställning för IT utveckling
* god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.
* teoretiskt eller praktiskt förvärvad kunskap om kraftsystem, balansering eller elmarknad.


Det är meriterande om du har:


* arbetslivserfarenhet av kontrollrumsnära verksamhet eller system
* erfarenhet av projektledning, testledning, processarbete eller förändringsledning
* erfarenhet av arbete inom stora agila organisationer

**Bra att veta**
----------------


* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 % #LI-hybrid
* Resor förekommer i denna tjänst främst inom Norden ca 3 gång i månaden
* Sista ansökningsdag, **12 augusti 2024**, vi tar inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning
* Under semestertider kan det vara svårt att nå oss


Kontakta gärna rekryterande chef ,Robert Söderholm, tel. nr. +46 72 459 86 85 alternativt ansvarig rekryterare ,AnnSophie Brezén, tel. nr. 475 80 07 . Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 84 72 och Mikael Wallin, ST, 010 475 84 94. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se.


**Övrig information**
---------------------


Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Important note:** Please remember to include your grade transcript along with your CV when submitting your application.
  
  

**The team :** Our team consists of 8-10 engineers and is responsible for an application for delivery of optimization services for large financial institutions. We value working with passionate, talented and nice people who have fun together, while pushing ourselves and our systems to improve continuously. Our architecture is clean and modern and based upon patterns like automated testing, modulation, clear boundaries and clear responsibilities, and we believe in continuous and iterative delivery, fail fast, prototyping and continuous feedback from internal and external clients.
  
  

**The impact :** OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade. We keep our eyes on the horizon, always on the lookout for new possibilities and opportunities while staying with our feet on the ground, making sure we deliver rock solid services that our clients rely on for their daily business and success. Our optimization services create distinct positive impacts to client portfolio risk profiles and operational costs. When our services execute, global metrics of systemic risks in the financial markets improve significantly. Long-term value to the client is the most important goal of our team, and your contribution in the form of delivery, improvements and innovations can have a significant impact on the financial system.
  
  

**What’s in it for you :** We strongly believe in individual growth and have long experience in guiding early careers engineers in our modern approach to software production, which includes:
  
  

Rapid, iterative and phased delivery, backed by automated testing and deployment frameworks.
  
  

Streamlined, autonomous and independent teams, optimized and supported for fast change.
  
  

Clean architecture for maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with the team structures and with clear boundaries and responsibilities.
  
  

Innovative culture with strong focus on exploration and prototyping, where failing fast is a virtue which drives technological and product improvements.
  
  

Software Engineer Position Profile
  
  

We are seeking a passionate and talented individual to join our innovative and forward-thinking team as a Software Engineer during the summer of 2024. Our company is at the forefront of rapid, iterative, and phased delivery, backed by cutting-edge automated testing and deployment frameworks. We believe in streamlined, autonomous, and independent teams that are optimized and supported for swift adaptability. Our commitment to clean architecture ensures maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with team structures and defined responsibilities.
  
  

**Role Overview :**  

As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to the success of our projects using your focus, talent, passion, and grit. We are looking for candidates who hold a Master's degree in Computer Science or have equivalent education or background, and have 3-5 years of relevant work experience. We foster an innovative culture that places a strong emphasis on exploration and prototyping. Here, failing fast is seen as a virtue, propelling technological and product improvements.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities :**  

Collaborate with cross-functional, autonomous teams for rapid and phased delivery.
  
  

Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility.
  
  

Contribute to an innovative culture through exploration, prototyping, and a willingness to take calculated risks.
  
  

Engage in continuous learning to stay abreast of the latest technologies and industry best practices.
  
  

**Qualifications :**  

Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent background.
  
  

3-5 years of relevant experience.
  
  

Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for learning.
  
  

Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment.
  
  

Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute ideas to a diverse team.
  
  

If you are a tech enthusiast with a thirst for innovation and a desire to contribute to an exciting and fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us as we redefine the boundaries of technology and drive impactful change in the industry.
  
  

About OSTTRA
  
  

Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.
  
  

OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
  
With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
  
Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
  
  

Learn more at www.osttra.com .
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health & Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
  
  

-----------------------------------------------------------
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer
  
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
  
  

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
  
  

**US Candidates Only:** The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

**Posted On:** 2024-07-08

description:

emagine i looking for a Senior IT Analys for an assignment within Banking/Finace

We need an additional IT analyst to our payments team within the Core banking program. title: IT Projektledare (E-handel)
description:
**Start****18-08-2024****Duration****10-12 months**
  
Emagine söker nu efter en IT Projektledare inom E-handel för en transformationsresa till vår fantastiska kund i Stockholm.

 **Start:** 2024-08-19  

**Slut:** 2025-06-30

**Stationeringsort:** Stockholm/Solna  

**Pris:** 740 till konsult

**IT-Projektledare till vår tekniska transformationsresa:**


Är du redo att hjälpa människor till bättre hälsa och påverka ca 50 miljoner kundmöten om året? Hos oss står vi inför en spännande förändring där vi moderniserar våra nuvarande tekniska plattformar för att bättre matcha våra medarbetares behov av systemstöd och leva upp till de högt ställda förväntningar våra kunder har på oss.

 **Ditt uppdrag:**


Som IT-projektledare hos oss kommer du ha en nyckelroll i att byta ut delar av systemstödet för vår kärnverksamhet, som stöttar närmare 400 butiker och ehandel i kundmötet. I detta uppdrag kommer du att leda projektet med att byta ut vår befintliga ehandelsplattform mot en ny, toppmodern lösning. Din roll blir central i att säkerställa en smidig övergång och att projektet levererar värde till både kunder och verksamheten. Du kommer att arbeta nära både våra interna utvecklingsteam och en extern leverantör som ansvarar för utveckling och implementering av den nya plattformen samt att bygga en ny ehandel. Du kommer också att säkerställa att projektet drivs i följsam takt med andra parallella projekt inom programmet, vilket kräver utmärkt koordination och kommunikationsförmåga.

 **Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:**


Leda projektets genomförande med både interna och externa parter.


Identifiera och definiera krav i samarbete med verksamheten.


Ansvara för ekonomisk uppföljning gentemot interna och externa parter.


Proaktivt identifiera, utvärdera och hantera potentiella risker i projektet.


Förbereda för lansering, inklusive testning och pilotimplementering.

title: Senior IT Analyst
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****4-6 months**
  
Emagine are now looking for a Senior IT Analyst to one of our amazing nordic banking clients in Stockholm.
  

  

**Start date:** ASAP

**End date:** 2024-12-31  

**Location:** Stockholm (3 days on site, 2 days remote)

 **Detailed description of work task to be carried out**


NCS / Data Engine & Mapping Introduction


The Data Engine and Mapping team is responsible for replicating and migrating collateral data from the various collateral legacy solutions in clients to the their Collateral Solution (NCS). This entails the data analysis and data mapping of the legacy data to the NCS data model, development and testing of replication/migration engines for the collateral data, data verification of replicated data, driving and orchestrating the business verification and close cooperation with our stakeholders before we secure the final migration of the data to the new solution.

**Your key responsibilities:**

* working within a cross functional agile scrum team,
* focusing on preparing data migration within ETL process,
* continuously working on quality assurance within migrated data,
* preparing functional and non-functional requirements,
* analysing and interpreting data from various sources as part of requirement analysis,
* documenting analysis/data mapping rules and ensuring approval from relevant process/solution forums,
* ensuring alignment and transparency of requirements by acting as a bridge between IT and business teams,
* taking a leading or facilitating role when multiple roles are needed to solve a problem,
* supporting data releases into new platform,

**Description of knowledge and experience**


Your preferred skills and qualifications:

* experience in Data Mapping and/or Business Process Modelling
* experience in data warehousing, data migration from legacy systems or data integration
* knowledge of ETL process & data integration tools (DataStage, Informatica, etc.)
* SQL / DB background
* familiarity with any RDBMS tools, preferably Oracle
* ability to write technical documentation and diagram workflows
* experience in understanding business requirements and translating into technical implementations
* communication with stakeholders to understand their requirements
* fluency in English
* Credit and Collateral processes understanding is an asset

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Since 2014, Acast has been creating the world’s most valuable podcast marketplace, building the technology which connects podcast creators, advertisers and listeners.  

  

Its marketplace spans more than 100,000 podcasts, 2,300 advertisers and 400 million monthly listens. Crucially, those listens are monetized wherever they happen - across any podcasting app or other listening platform.  

The company operates worldwide and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden. Acast is listed on the Nasdaq First North Premier Growth Market (ACAST.ST) **Location:**
Please note, this role can be based in the UK, France or Sweden on an in-country, remote basis. **About the role:**
We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer that has experience with backend development, ideally in the JavaScript ecosystem.  

You will be a crucial part of an autonomous team, taking full ownership of features and driving them from inception to delivery while continuously increasing efficiency, stability and scalability of the systems. **What you’ll do:**
You will be working in a multi-disciplinary environment with agile principles.  

You’ll work across the full stack, from frontend to backend, ensuring seamless integration and performance.  

You’ll Implement and maintain CI/CD pipelines to automate testing and deployment processes.  

You’ll contribute to code reviews, providing and receiving constructive feedback to ensure code quality and best practices. **Who you are**:
You’re a senior engineer with a proven track record of building and deploying applications on AWS  

You thrive in a startup environment  

You speak fluent English  

  

**Where you'll be**
Most of our teams are hybrids with some members co-located in offices and some working remote. With a remote first way of working we want you to feel productive regardless of work location!  

Where? For this role, it can be within the UK, France or Sweden  

Working hours? We want to avoid teams distributed over time-zones, so this team will operate within the CET time zone for collaboration. This setup allows us for more flexibility and work-life balance.  

Acast is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, national origin or any of the other wonderful characteristics that make us different.  

Culture is our number one priority as a business. We believe people come first, and we work every day to enable autonomy, continuous improvement and bring out the best in people. We’re global and have remote teams, so it’s even more important that we strive for an open, inclusive and caring environment where everyone feels visible and welcome. We consider ourselves a modern organization driven by strong values to create the best, most fulfilling and nurturing culture.  

We very much look forward to finding the next great person to join our cause!
