* du har god analytisk förmåga, och kan angripa frågor utifrån ett brett perspektiv. Vidare har du lätt för att samarbeta och kan förankra idéer hos både teammedlemmar, chefer och andra kollegor. Det är viktigt att du har en god förmåga att visualisera och förklara frågor på ett enkelt och begripligt sätt.
* Specialist på systemet ur ett funktionellt perspektiv och kunnig inom verksamhetsdomän
* Dokumenterar affärskrav som funktionella- och icke funktionella krav i kravställningsmall
* Bidra till att systemförvaltningslistan/förbättringslistan är uppdaterad
* Insatt i kravställning- och utvecklingsprocessen. Deltar i tester.
* Tät samverkan med superuser och förvaltningsledare
* Kompetens och behörigheter till ett eller flera system
* Specialist på systemet ur ett användarperspektiv
* Träna och hjälpa kollegor i att använda systemet och att skapa nya processer
* Bidra med idéer och vidareutvecklingsförslag
* Utbyta erfarenheter med Systemägare/systemansvarig samt diskutera förslag som kommit in från användare


**Start: augusti/september efter överenskommelse
   

  

 Omfattning: 100%**
**Språk: Svenska**
**Vänligen ansök snarast med:**
* Ditt uppdaterade CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* En kort motivering varför du är lämplig uppdraget.

title: Digital solution consultant process performance
description:
***This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.***
 This position reports to
   

  

 Principal Technical Consultant
   

  

 Your role and responsibilities
   

  

 In this role, you will have the opportunity to drive the execution of the digital ecosystem strategy in the assigned area. Each day, you will support in developing and implementing a comprehensive digital ecosystem, covering one or more specific assigned such as channels and partnerships for co-creation, onboarding, and monitoring solutions on ABB marketplace. You will also showcase your expertise by demonstrating a solid understanding of digitalization needs and trends in the industry and assigned aspects of the digital ecosystem. Capture market opportunities, understand customer drivers and digitalization needs, develop and evolve technology partnerships and translate these into a solution-based business strategy to leverage untapped digital value Develop and implement appropriate and often new business models for digital transformation opportunities in Process Performance (Advanced Process Control APC/MPC, Analytics, Performance Services, Simulation) with customers in all Process Industries verticals (Mining, Pulp & Paper, Metals, Food & Beverage) Analyzes customer requirements to ensure digital solution(s) meets objectives by combining industry best practices, product knowledge, and business acumen Acts as a high-level technical expert for the Process Performance portfolio across Process Industries verticals, providing knowledge and analysis of specialized software applications and operational environments, functional systems analysis, design, integration, and implementation advice for complex digital solution implementation Provides direction and mentoring to sales and project teams Interfaces with and influences customerâs senior technical and business leadership Continuously drives business development efforts by pursuing new opportunities and extensions with sales teams
   

  

**Qualifications For The Role**
* 5+ years of experience driving digital transformation in complex global organizations, ideally in a B2B environment (Process, Energy, software, technology, automation).
* Bachelorâs/Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related technical field.
* Hands-on experience in the OT/software industry with a focus on digitalization and Industrial Software. Deep understanding of relevant technologies and trends.
* Proven track record in consultative selling, with a strong customer focus, exposure to top management, driving results, building pipeline, and turning opportunities into sales successes.
* Ability to drive success in direct and matrix organizations.
* Thorough understanding of the industry customer's end-to-end digital journey through hands-on exposure to transformation planning initiatives. Implemented APC through a full lifecycle from requirements gathering to aftermarket support.
* Deep experience in the industrial software environment; division-specific industry exposure (industrial automation/advanced software) preferred; experience and background in one or more of the division industrial domains such as Mining, Pulp & Paper, Metals, Cement, Food & Beverage.
* Background in cloud and edge technologies, digital twins, analytics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning as applied to Process Performance solutions.
* Experience in the justification, design, implementation, and maintenance of process control applications.
* Understanding of pre-test, tuning, step testing, model identification, inferential deployment, interfacing, and commissioning.
* Excellent networking skills developed in a highly international organization, with a âleading by influenceâ approach.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, with additional languages being a plus.
* Availability to travel regionally as required.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

* Learn from highly experienced, genuine, and caring colleagues â people who are committed to helping you achieve your personal and professional goals.
* Help customers in driving efficiency and sustainability, making a strong impact
* Get exposed to cutting-edge technology in Process Automation and have a visible impact on the future


 More about us
   

  

 The Process Industries Division serves the mining, minerals processing, metals, cement, pulp and paper, battery manufacturing, and food and beverage, as well as their associated service industries. The Division brings deep industry domain expertise coupled with the ability to integrate both automation and electrical systems, increase productivity and reduce overall capital and operating costs for customers. For mining, metals and cement customers, solutions include specialized products and services, as well as total production systems. The Division designs, plans, engineers, supplies, installs and commissions integrated electrical and motion systems, including electric equipment, drives, motors, high power rectifiers and equipment for automation and supervisory control within a variety of areas including mineral handling, mining operations, aluminum smelting, hot and cold steel applications and cement production. The offering for the pulp and paper industries includes control systems, quality control systems, drive systems, on-line sensors, actuators and field instruments. Digitalization solutions, including collaborative operations and augmented reality, help improve plant and enterprise productivity, and reduce maintenance and energy costs. We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

title: Business Analyst to big bank in Stockholm!
description:
We are looking for an individual with experience in the finance industry who is ready to take on this exciting position! In this role, you will play a key role in analyzing data to improve the monitoring and identification of suspicious behavior in the financial market in order to prevent financial crimes.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm, Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Finance / Law / Purchase
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, with possibility to work remote
 



  

**Start date :**
 ASAP
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 The bank is constantly working to improve integrity and compliance with regulations in financial institutions industry by identifying and preventing various forms of financial crime, including sanctions circumvention, money laundering and terrorist financing.
 


  


 In this role, you will work on projects aimed at analyzing and preparing big data with the goal of preventing financial crimes. You will be part of an experienced team and have the opportunity to learn and develop by working with colleagues both locally and internationally. This is a long-term assignment through Academic Work with the possibility of direct recruitment by the bank if all parties are satisfied with the cooperation.
 


  


  

**You are offered:**



  

  
* The opportunity to become part of a large international company at the forefront of technology.
  
* The chance to develop internally and increase your expertise in banking and finance.
  
* A dedicated consultant manager from Academic Work who will support and coach you in your future career.
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Create high-quality analyses and presentation materials for senior management
  
* Identify potential improvements/optimizations/automations and implement new solutions
  
* Analyze big data and apply it for the purpose of crime prevention
  
* Work as the link between tech and business with the aim of translating requirements to create new solutions
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Academic background in quantitative fields such as finance, computer science, or mathematics.
  
* Proficiency in English excellent knowledge of both spoken and written English.
  
* At least 1 year of prior experience in data analysis within a big data environment.
  
* Strong skills in communication and stakeholder management.
  
* Understanding of agile working practices.
  
* Good knowledge of Hadoop.
  
* Proficient in Excel.
  
* Skilled in Python.
  
* Competent in SQL.
  
* Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS/Snowflake).
  
* Swedish citizenship or a valid work permit enabling immediate start in the position.
  


  


  

**It will be seen as a merit if you have...**



  

  
* Experience in the financial sector.
  
* Knowledge or experience in financial crime prevention.
  
* Experience working in large-scale transformation programs.
  
* Project management experience.
  


  


  

**To succeed in this role we se that you possess the following personal characteristics:**



  

  
* Analytical
  
* Structured
  
* Collaborative
  
* Communicative
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Milla Olsson or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stw01@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15104175

title: Azure Data Architect (Location: Sthlm, Gbg, Malmö or Helsingborg)
description:
Insights & data is a global business line within Capgemini, comprising 27,000 experts. Our focus? Creating reliable, scalable data platforms with cutting-edge technology. From Gen-AI to business intelligence, we cover it all. Join us in transforming industries through end-to-end Data & AI solutions. We work across industries and have a collaborative environment, where your unique perspective matters.
 



  





**YOUR ROLE** 




 Are you passionate about shaping data-driven solutions for clients in different industries? Want to be part of a strong community of 10 000 Architects globally?
 



  





 Capgemini has partnership with Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Databricks and Snowflake. Although we believe that your expertise lies within Azure services, as an Architect within our organization, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a variety of services, such as Microsoft Azure/Fabric, Snowflake, Databricks, AWS or GCP. On top of that, you’ll be provided with a lot of opportunities to collaborate with other Architects in Sweden as well as across the Nordics.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* **Drive innovation and change** 
 : Actively engage with the partner ecosystem to generate market presence and create opportunities.
* **Design** 
 : Shape and own the end-to- end solution to ensure overall data quality, evolutionary architectures, security, and maintainability and performance.
* **Collaborate** 
 : Work closely with stakeholders, developers, and analysts to understand business needs. Providing leadership and direction to the technical teams and being a partner to the engagement manager and jointly own the delivery.
* **Implement** 
 : Translate requirements into practical solutions, ensuring data quality, security, and performance.
* **Guide** 
 : Mentor junior team members and share best practices.



  





**YOUR PROFILE** 



* 7+ years of working within data & analytics as a Lead Data Engineer or Architect.
* Data Modeling: Strong understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
* Practical work experience in Azure services; networks, storage, data and analytics services, security and databases (Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL, Databricks, etc.).
* Experience in architecting and designing data solutions using trade-off analysis.
* Knowledge of different information architecture patterns (e.g., dimensional model, data vault 2.0, data mesh, lakehouse).
* Familiarity with DevOps tools, including version control (Git) and CI/CD pipelines.
* Experienced in architecture governance and documentation.
* Experienced in data management, data security, and access control in the cloud.
* Prototyping mindset and familiarity with Python and SQL.
* Problem Solver: Analytical mindset to tackle complex challenges.
* We welcome both English and Swedish speaking candidates that are currently located in Sweden.



  





**WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE** 




 We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
 



 At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
 



 Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies such as Databricks and Microsoft Azure.
 



  





**APPLICATION** 




 Ready to join our team? Apply Now!
 



  





**ABOUT CAPGEMINI** 




 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
 



  





 Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com

title: Group Expert IT OT Backup Engineer
description:
Do you want to combine the opportunities that a global company provides with the advantages of a family-owned business? Octapharma is a biotechnology pharmaceutical company - with a vision to improve people's health and lives.
   

  

 What will you do as a “Group Expert IT OT Backup Engineer”?
   

  

 You will be joining a global team of IT experts with deep knowledge in many IT areas. As a Backup Engineer your primary focus is to ensure the operation, reliability, and integrity of our backups operational technology (OT) systems, safeguarding critical industrial data and system across all production sites.
   

  

* Backup Management: Operate, implement, and maintain backup solutions for OT systems.
* Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve any issues related to backup processes and systems.
* Compliance: Ensure backup processes adhere to industry standards and regulatory requirements.
* Documentation: Maintain detailed records of backup configurations, procedures, and recovery plans.
* Monitoring: Continuously monitor backup operations to identify and address potential issues proactively.
* Collaboration: Work closely with IT and OT teams to align backup strategies with overall organizational goals.
* Capacity Planning: Plan and manage storage capacity to ensure adequate space for current and future backup needs.
* Disaster Recovery: Develop and implement disaster recovery plans to minimize downtime and data loss in case of system failures.
* Develop, test, implement, and benchmark new backup systems, solutions, and procedures to ensure data integrity and availability.


 Your Profile
   

  

* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field is required.
* 3 to 5 years work experience in IT and/or OT
* Experience in backup/restore of IT infrastructure components such as VMware, Windows, Linux, SQL and/or Oracle is required.
* Knowledge of operational technology (OT) systems are highly preferred.
* Experience in an GxP environment preferred.
* Knowledge of VMware, Windows, Linux, and databases are highly preferred.


 The departments within IT
   

  

* The department Business Technology is divided into the product teams Endpoint, Network, Data Center/Infrastructure Security, Digital Workplace and Data Protection Services and works closely with the others IT areas like Production IT and IT Security
* Delivers infrastructure, networks and communication and ensures the operation of systems within all Octapharma locations
* The IT department ensures that IT solutions work and meet the requirements of the business
* The department Business Technology consists of 24 people, and you report to the head of the Data Protection Services platform team.


 What is the best thing about working with us?
   

  

* You contribute to saving lives - Every day is meaningful as we manufacture life-saving medicines
* Benefits – Bonus program, benefits
* Family values - Long-term perspective regarding personnel and relationships
* Competence development - We offer, among other things, several different employee and leadership training courses, both internal and external, trainee programs and digital solutions


 Apply today!
   

  

 If you have questions about the position, contact Erik Strandberg (recruiting manager) at +468 566 431 39 or erik.strandberg@octapharma.com. The application deadline is 2024-08-05, the position can be filled before then.
   

  

 If you go further in the process
   

  

* We want to collect as much information as possible early in the process to be able to make the best match
* Within a few days, you will be able to carry out occupational psychology tests
* The tests are done early in the process because we want to ensure an objective, unbiased and fair selection process


**Additional Information**
 The minimum gross wage according to the collective agreement (chemical industry) for your new job is EUR 4.157,14. We strive to adapt your salary to your range of tasks and to your profile, which is why we are ready to pay wages higher than collectively agreed. This is a legal requirement in Austria which is not applicable for Switzerland.
   

  

 We are looking forward to new, committed employees who join forces with us to promote our strong growth in order to keep enabling our patients to live a better life - because it is in our blood! Is it in your blood too? We are looking forward to receiving your application via our online career portal.

title: Enterprise Data Architect
description:
*Are you a data enthusiast who* 
 enjoys
 *solving complex problems and finding innovative solutions? Do you thrive in a* 
 diverse
 *environment and enjoy working both* 
 directly
 *and collaboratively? If so, GlobalConnect is looking for you!*
**About the Role:** 
 As an Enterprise Data Architect at GlobalConnect, you'll play a crucial role in enhancing our data management and integration across the organization. You will evaluate and optimize existing systems, ensuring high-quality data governance and seamless integration to support business processes. You’ll define the organization's data vision and put it into practice
 **.**
**What You Will Do:** 
 In this role, you will spend your days analyzing current systems, identifying and resolving data-related issues, and developing and implementing data strategies that are in line with business processes. The strategy includes data model designs, database development standards, and data integration and management. You will document and communicate data architecture processes, collaborate with colleagues and external vendors, and support business units in data-related decisions. A normal day involves reviewing reports, attending team stand-ups, working on data quality projects, and developing solutions to improve our data infrastructure.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* System Analysis: Evaluate existing systems and identify data-related problems.
* Data Management Optimization: Develop and implement strategies for data integration and quality improvement to ensure data accuracy and accessibility.
* Documentation and Communication: Create comprehensive documentation and communicate complex data concepts to stakeholders.
* Business requirement: Translate business requirements into databases, data warehouse and data streams.
* Data Analysis: Analysing, planning and define data architecture framework, including security, reference data, metadata, and master data
* Collaboration: Work closely with team members and external vendors to ensure effective data handling.


**The Team and Why GlobalConnect:**
 You will join a diverse team of four members based in Denmark and Sweden, specializing in sales, technical delivery, and troubleshooting. We value open communication, collaboration, and continuous learning. Our department offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact by improving our data handling and decision-making processes. As a leader, I prioritize professional development and creating an environment that encourages innovation and problem-solving.
   

  

**To Succeed We Think You Need:**
* Master Data Management: Experience with enterprise-level master data management, including data governance and quality. Used to working with data mining to uncover pattens, anomalies and correlations in large data sets.
* Data Analysis and Processing: Comprehensive skills in data analysis, processing, and visualization using tools like Excel and SQL.
* Scripting and Programming: Competence in scripting and programming (e.g., Python or SQL) to manipulate and analyze large datasets.
* Documentation and Communication: Ability to document complex data processes and communicate technical information clearly in English.
* Data modelling: Using tools like Erwin, Visio or similar, to visualise metadata and database schema.


**Why Join Us?** 
 By joining GlobalConnect, you'll be at the heart of one of the most progressive telecom companies in Northern Europe. You'll have the chance to directly influence our success through precise and efficient data integration. We offer a collaborative and innovative environment where your contributions will have a real impact.
   

  

 If you're ready to solve complex challenges and make a significant impact with your data expertise, we want to hear from you. Apply today and let's build a data-driven future together!
   

  

**Apply Now!** 
 We look forward to starting this journey with you.

title: Project Manager | ERP Delivery Manager
description:
Do you always deliver what you've promised? So do we! At the heart of every great technology solution are great people who always make sure the project delivers what it set out to do and matches expectations.  You’re a proactive and eager-to-act individual contributor who loves solving problems with technology and using your good interpersonal and organizational skills to build positive relationships. We’ll surround you with people who are as passionate about technology and innovation as you are.
   

  

**Come join us**
 ERP is all about helping businesses simplify complexity and thrive in the digital age. You’ll be solving your client’s challenges and turning their needs into goals and solutions through Microsoft Dynamics 365. Working as part of the ERP team you’ll collect information, analyze requirements and solve problems, providing technical and operational support. Together we do what matters.
   

  

**Skills And Experiences**
* Previous experience in the role of project manager for ERP system implementations
* Knowledge of PM methodologies (Agile, Waterfall)
* Ability to set deadlines, assign responsibilities to work teams, and monitor the progress of activities.
* Ability to relate effectively with internal and external customers.
* PMI certification will be considered an asset.


**About You**
 Characteristics that can spell success for this role:
   

  

* Consultative, collaborative, relationship builder
* Resilient, adaptable, flexible
* Intellectually curious and passionate about tech
* Convincing storyteller and engaging content creator


**What You'll Do**
 With the role of
 *Project Manager* 
 in ERP you will be responsible for the success of our projects, organizing, managing and monitoring work teams, methodologies and technologies, from the requirements analysis phase to the project delivery phase to client companies.
   

  

**Learn more**
 To learn more about the types of projects our ERP team works on check out these case studies:
   

  

* https://youtu.be/V6D-gdjWbgw
* https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6qb6Lq40vtQ&list=PLoP-4KVd7rBwPIOn4\_J0RVzvlkc48-w2w


 Interested in knowing what’s going on inside Avanade? Check out our blogs:
   

  

* Avanade Insights – exchange ideas that drive tomorrow’s innovation
* Inside Avanade – explore what life is like working at Avanade


**Enjoy your career**
**Some Of The Best Things About Working At Avanade**
* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (14 years in a row), with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


**Benefits**
 Find out more about some of our benefits here.
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one

title: Senior .Net Utvecklare | Stockholm
description:
På Grant Thornton kommer du till en stark teamkultur där alla får komma till tals och där korta beslutsvägar och prestigelöshet hjälper oss att bidra till kundernas utveckling. Med ett starkt samarbete mellan våra olika specialistområden kan vi erbjuda en bredd av både kompetens och karriärvägar.
   

  

*Vår IT-avdelning befinner sig i en spännande fas av omvandling, och vi vill förstärka vårt utvecklingsteam med senior kompetens inom .Net!*
*Träffa några av dina framtida kollegor:*
**Om rollen:**
 Som senior .Net-utvecklare på Grant Thornton spelar du en central roll med stora möjligheter att bidra med tekniska lösningar och influera hur vi bedriver vårt utvecklingsarbete. Det här är chansen för dig att verkligen göra avtryck inom en IT-organisation.
   

  

 Rollen innebär att du kommer att vara med i vårt utvecklingsteam där vi jobbar för att tillgodose verksamheternas behov med smarta och effektiva lösningar. Vi jobbar med allt ifrån att vidareutveckla våra interna webapplikationer, bygga nya integrationer, applikationer för att möjliggöra vår resa mot Machine Learning och AI.
   

  

***Bland dina ansvarsområden kommer du att:***
* Delta aktivt i design och implementering av våra systemlösningar.
* Säkerställa kvalitativ kodning enligt bästa praxis inom .Net-utveckling.
* Samarbeta nära med andra utvecklare, projektledare/produktägare, QA för att säkerställa hög kvalitet i våra system.
* Ha möjlighet att påverka och ge input till vår övergripande mjukvaruarkitektur och utvecklingsmetodik.


***Vem söker vi?***
 För att trivas och lyckas i denna roll bör du vara genuint nyfiken med ett starkt intresse för utveckling. Med över 5 års erfarenhet som .Net-utvecklare har du en gedigen kunskap inom området där vi även gärna ser att du har erfarenhet av att arbeta med React, där du har en gedigen förståelse för dess komponentbaserade arkitektur och tillhörande ekosystem. Din kreativa ådra gör att du kontinuerligt kommer med innovativa lösningar, och din analytiska sida tillåter dig att reflektera över och förbättra pågående arbetsprocesser.
   

  

***Vi ser att du har:***
* En djup teknisk kunskap inom IT, särskilt inom Microsoft-plattformen. Din erfarenhet bör omfatta teknologier som .Net, Azure, MS SQL, AspNet. Utvecklingsarbetet sker främst i C#.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av Azures olika funktioner såsom Azure App Service, Azure Storage, Azure Functions och Azure Cosmos DB.
* Stor förståelse för DevOps-principer och metoder, med särskild erfarenhet av att tillämpa dessa i komplexa utvecklingsmiljöer.


 Som individ är du en kommunikativ och engagerad teamspelare. Du prioriterar gruppens framgång och trivs i en ledande position inom en agil arbetsmiljö. Vi ser gärna att du antingen bor i Storstockholmsområdet eller har planer på att flytta hit snart, och kan arbeta på vårt kontor regelbundet.
   

  

***Vad vi erbjuder***
 Vi tror på en balans mellan lagarbete, prestation, trivsel och personlig utveckling. Här är alla individer värdefulla och varje medarbetares insats märks. Du har möjligheten att sätta dina egna mål och verkligen göra skillnad. Framtiden är det du gör den till.
   

  

**Rekryteringsprocessen:**
 Tjänsten avser heltid med start enligt överenskommelse. I denna rekryteringsprocess samarbetar vi med Ants. När du klickar på Ansök-länken kommer till annonsen hos Ants.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer om Grant Thornton som arbetsgivare?**
* Våra förmåner
* Våra affärsområden
* Dina eventuellt framtida kollegor
* Vår kultur och våra värderingar
* Om Grant Thornton


**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Business Solutions Consultant
description:
At Volue we are realizing the Green Transition. Our mission is to provide innovative services critical to society, unlocking a cleaner, better and more profitable future. Working towards this goal, Volue has become a leading technology supplier and enabler of the green transition, helping energy companies simplify and optimize everyday operations.
 



 We are now looking for a Senior Business Solution Consultant to join our team in Volue who can help us to continuously improve Volue’s ability to provide value to customers in line with the Volue mission. In this area, we deliver a comprehensive suite of decision support tools for power production planning, optimization and trading to energy companies in more than 20 countries.
 



 In this role, you will enable energy companies to use their resources most efficiently by utilizing Volue software solutions. In order to achieve this, you will be working together with other Volue consultants and customers worldwide on our software delivery projects.
 



 Senior Business Solution Consultant role involves frequent and close customer and internal contact (Sales, Product Management, Development, Support) regarding software solutions.
 



 Therefore, we are looking for communicators and explorers, who know their way around technology and energy.
 



  





**What you will be doing to make a difference:** 




  




* Understanding what our customers’ needs, challenges and requirements are.
* Configuring our software according to the customer's needs
* Assessing clients' current processes, systems, and workflows and setting up the customer’s business processes in our tools
* Facilitating integration with the customers’ other IT solutions
* Attending customer meetings and workshops
* Supporting Project Managers and Product Managers on the necessary
* Contributing to closing sales cases by estimating new projects, running demos, giving input to solution design



  





**What you need to succeed:** 




  




* Min. 3+ years of experience within energy sector
* Knowledge about European power markets
* Experience with software implementation and project management
* Ability to build and maintain strong client relationships
* Experience with facilitating workshops tailored to customer needs
* Proactivity and ability to manage own workload and work in the team
* In addition, it would be valuable if you have experience with leading teams, but it is not a must.



  





**Reasons to join Volue team and what we offer:** 




  




* Large degree of influence in shaping and developing the role further
* Exciting position with the newest technology for the energy business
* Great colleagues in one of Europe’s most exciting green tech companies with innovative and international work environment
* Flexible working hours
* Competitive compensation package



  





 In Volue, we cherish each employee’s competence, ideas and personality. Let your skills and talent be a part of our team – and let us leave our mark on the world together!
 



  





**Company Culture** 




  





 In Volue, we believe that in order to be a successful company, we need to bring everyone to the table.
 



 We look at diversity as a competitive advantage. A diverse workforce enables better decision-making and creates more value. By inclusion, we refer to the sense of belonging and being part of a community at work. We want the people of Volue to feel welcome, valued and not least encouraged to bring their whole, unique selves to work.
 



 Volue is about people. From staff to client, people are at the center of all our operations, and we always strive for a flat structure where everyone feels included, appreciated and recognized for their individual efforts. Or as we call it "ONE Volue". We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, cultural background or religious beliefs.

title: Quality Officer
description:
**QUALITY OFFICER FOR A DATA CENTER IN STOCKHOLM** 




  





 On behalf of Digital Realty, Kelly is searching for a Quality Officer. The increasing demand for IT infrastructure is clear, the Stockholm campus and data centers are strategically located to meet the need for business-critical IT infrastructure. Digital Realty is a leading provider of data center services across EMEA.
 



  





 The role as the Quality Officer is to leverage quality standards in order to adhere to Digital Realty policies and regulations, ensure compliance to internal and external quality and information security requirements, support optimal data security and support our H&S work and Environmental & Sustainability work. This including all related compliances, certifications and audits and related HQ policies to the local team. Represent Digital Realty Nordic towards customers, auditors etc. Contributes to the achievement of the Quality goals and objectives of the Nordic Operation.
 



  





 Are you ready to take on a new opportunity as Quality Officer within Digital Realty? Then join us and take pride in being a part of this vital area and you’ll discover a supportive and open environment where you’ll be encouraged to be yourself. This means you’ll have the chance to work with people from different business areas, challenge the way we do things and put your ideas into action. We’ll also give you plenty of training and development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career.
 



  





  





  





**YOUR PRIMARY WORK TASKS** 



* Host/participate in (external) audits required by customers and as set by local R&R to verify actual compliance
* Maintain and uphold Quality Assurance procedures
* Provides input into request for proposal on Quality & Information Security issues
* Monitor alignment with internal Quality and Information Security standards and recommend corrective action if necessary
* Develops and maintain Quality and Information Security policies and procedures.
* Respond to contingent events
* Monitor the development of crisis resolution plans for Quality & Information Security related issues
* Assist Operation with Business Continuity tests and documentation
* Coaching / instructing / motivating staff to work according to agreed guidelines and procedures
* Register and report operational incidents
* Ensure lessons learned is noted, follow up is performed and documented
* Ensure training and drills are performed and implemented by assisting operational teams



  





  





**PROFESSIONAL QUALIFICATIONS** 



* Good knowledge of relevant standards and certifications i.e.: ISO 27001, ISO22301, SOC2, PCI, GDPR
* Process knowledge of quality and/or audit processes and practices
* Familiar with ISO 14001, ISO50001, ISO45001 & ISO 9001
* Skills in developing and maintaining quality documentation
* Educated to a bachelor’s degree level or equivalent
* Proven experience as Quality / Compliance Officer or similar skillset
* Minimum 3 years of experience working with quality and certification work
* Experience working within a security environment, hosting quality and process audits
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, proficient in English and Swedish
* IT literacy; very good understanding of Microsoft Office



  





  





**PERSONAL QUALIFICATIONS** 




 High personal standards: always looking for higher standards with eye for compliance (zero defects)
 



  





 You are committed, internally driven and willing to go the extra mile, has the ability to identify opportunities and take the initiative to move forward to drive improvement
 



  





 Open for change; adapts to change, open to new ideas, takes on new responsibilities, handles pressure, adjusts plans to meet changing needs
 



  





 Pro-active: Has a can-do mentality
 



  





 Maintain a professional composure and positive approach even under high pressure situations
 



  





 A Clean criminal record
 



  





 A Police intelligence approval (as of 1st. of May 2024 Not required)
 



  





  





  





**YOU ARE OFFERED** 



* A rapidly evolving business sector offers the opportunity to be part of a courageous and passionate team who work together to understand and meet the changing needs of our global customers.
* At Digital Realty you’ll be part of a supportive and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. As part of the Nordic Quality team, you’ll get to collaborate with people from different business areas, challenge the way things are done and put your ideas into action.
* You will also be given plenty of development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career with Digital Realty.
* You will get registered via DLR University, with an individual development plan and in local ISO sheets.



  





  





**APPLICATION** 




 If you are interested in the above position, press 'Apply now' and attach your complete CV. You can create a user profile on our website if you have additional relevant documents. All applications are treated with full discretion.
 



  





**APPLICATION DEADLINE** 




 We regularly call candidates for interview, so please submit your application as soon as possible. All applications are treated with full discretion.
 



  





**PLEASE FOLLOW US ON LINKEDIN AND FACEBOOK, TO CONTINUALLY KEEP UP TO DATE ON OUR VACANCIES.**

title: Account Executive - Enterprise - Nordics
description:
Why Join Us?
   

  

 Embark on an exciting journey with Check Point, a global cybersecurity industry leader.
   

  

 As a Sales Executive, you'll play a pivotal role in our venture-backed startup, recognized by Gartner and Forrester, contributing to transforming the security landscape with our cutting-edge Cybersecurity Experience (CSX) Platform.
   

  

 Join us in the Nordics to shape the future of this dynamic field within the robust framework of the Check Point family.
   

  

 Your role will involve closing deals, expanding our customer base, and influencing the security trajectory in a collaborative and vibrant environment.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Developing and executing sales plans to achieve quota for your assigned territory.
* Managing entire sales cycle for key enterprise deals.
* Working closely with the Sales team on building enterprise customer strategies, ensuring new opportunities are identified and managed
* Fostering growth & tracking the SSE sales pipeline by engaging with internal account teams, existing customers, net new prospects and key partners.
* Maintaining an accurate overlaying forecast of business opportunities and bookings in your assigned geography.
* Knowledge in CSM/Account management or similar customer-facing position, preferably working in the SaaS or cybersecurity sector.
* Preparing and giving regular business reviews to the management team highlighting attainment progress and challenges to closing business.
* Presenting to customers as a sales expert in Secure Service Edge and SASE solutions.
* Collaborating with the Channel organization to enable alliances and large SI to successfully sell and deploy Check Point SSE solutions.
* Ensuring an active presence at relevant industry Trade Shows and Check Point organized events.
* Delivering regular webinars and technical presentations.
* Growing to be a thought leader and trusted advisor for SSE solutions in your assigned territory
* Developing and leveraging executive relationships to succeed.


**Qualifications**
* 5-7 years of cybersecurity and Network Security sales experience.
* Experience with complex, 6 mos+ sales cycles, including procurement, collaboration with legal, and 6-figure ACV
* Self-motivated and 'Whatever it takes' attitude to assist in closing a deal and deliver above quota results.
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically and develop/execute corresponding objectives.
* Strong verbal and written communications, as well as the ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations.
* Experience getting into and successfully interfacing with “C” levels.
* Strong team player and collaborator
* Experience with Salesforce
* Degree in a related field, Business, Computer Science or Information Technology preferred


 Don't meet every requirement? No problem. We're committed to fostering a diverse team of individuals.
   

  

 If you believe you have what it takes to thrive in our passionate, fun, remote-friendly, and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.
   

  

 Your unique perspective might just challenge our preconceptions about who belongs in this role.

title: Game Product Owner (Slot Producer)
description:
Wanna be truly creative and work with a diverse gaming product from seed to actual released product? Maybe sick of releasing just one game every third or fifth year? Come join us as a game producer and be insanely creative and even be able to release your games before you are sick of them!
   

  

 We want to stand out and are not afraid to make games that changes the online slots industry. Are you the person that can drive our products to the next level? Then we are very interested in getting in contact with you. We want you to fulfil one of our two wishes; that you either come from the gaming industry, or even better, are working specifically with slot games and have great knowledge in casino products. You need to have a general passion for games!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Innovative thinker and daredevil that wants to create new and exciting game concepts.
* Making sure that the games teams run smoothly and can deliver badass slots.
* Guide and give feedback on game productions, not just your own.
* Create an excellent player experience and continuously improving our slot games production.
* Ready to work with all aspects of the product – development, math, compliance, marketing and sales.
* Research, play and study slot games and watch market trends and competitors.


 Who you are
   

  

* Passionate to create fun and exciting games.
* A person that can help our amazing team of developers create the best game in the casino market!
* You love to drive and create the game concepts and our way forward, to build a solid games portfolio together with our team.
* Can perfectly switch between working with developers one day and sales and customers the next.
* Excellent organizational and communication skills (a classic!)
* Not afraid to make tough decisions and kill your darlings.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Game production experience within iGaming or Gaming industry.
* Gaming and slots nerd.
* Proven project- and/or people management skills.
* Understanding of mathematical fundamentals of slots.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta, Romania and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. We have no dependencies on other systems, which allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Business Analyst within Card Simplification Programme to big bank!
description:
Join a pioneering Card Simplification Programme (CSP) and drive the future of card payments across the Nordics. We're seeking a seasoned Business Analyst with deep expertise in card domains to harmonize product services and streamline operations. Welcome with your application!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 September
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 As a Senior Business Analyst within the Nordic Product Harmonization team, you will lead investigations and resolve discrepancies across card product offerings in the Nordic region. You'll collaborate closely with stakeholders to define and document business requirements, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives. This role offers an opportunity to influence the next generation of card management solutions, enhancing efficiency and customer experience.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Investigate, analyze, articulate and process rather complex business requirements and solutions
  
* Create requirement documentation for stakeholders in the form of epics, user features, process and service descriptions
  
* Prepare decision materials for senior management
  
* Drive analysis as part of a small team of Business Analysts
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Minimum 3-5 years’ experience in Card domain (preferably cards issuing from the business/product side). Past positions could be as a Product manager, SME, Process/Service manager, PO, development manager or alike
  
* Preferably experience from Nordic co-operation/International teams
  
* Generalist background with understanding of the whole cards value chain
  
* Ability to understand bot IT and Business and to be able to interact in both domains
  
* Strong Stakeholder management skills and self-drive
  
* Basic understanding of agile methodologies and tools like Jira and Confluence is a must
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Detailed end-to-end understanding of functionality and processes related to one or two cards areas like PIN mgnt, transactions flow incl 3DS or more
  
* Basic understanding of scheme rules and legislation as well as ability to define product strategy and roadmap
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Molly Rytter or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stw06@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105764

title: Produktionsledare till IT Infrastruktur och drift
description:
**Vi söker nu efter en Produktionsledare till IT Infrastruktur och drift till vår kund inom offentlig sektor.** 




  





**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Organisera och leda planeringsmöten för projektet.
* Planera och koordinera teamets och individernas uppgifter och leveranser.
* Ansvara för att hantera ett effektivt team av specialister inom IT för att genomföra projektet.
* Stötta och samarbeta med projektledare, tekniska projektledare och strömledare och tillsammans med dem bryta ner projektplanen i aktiviteter, prioritera och skapa uppgifter till teamet.
* Tilldela uppgifter, övervaka framsteg och ge feedback till teamet för att nå mål och säkerställa produktivitet.
* Arbeta nära projektets intressenter för att skapa sig en överblick och kunna dokumentera projektets behov.
* Kunna prioritera för effektiv leverans.
* Skapa och distribuera rapporter för att kunna följa projektets framsteg och att projektet levererar mot uppsatta mål.
* Övergripande ansvar för att projektet följer de säkerhetsdokument som gäller.
* Skapa en positiv och stödjande arbetsmiljö (utan arbetsmiljöansvar) för teamets medlemmar.
* Mer information om uppdraget förmedlas om man går vidare i urvalet.



  





**Skallkrav:** 



* Högskole-/universitetsutbildning om 120p/180hp
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat som teamledare, produktionsledare och/eller Scrum master under de senaste 10 åren.
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserenhet av att ha arbetat i minst 2 större IT- projekt under de senaste 10 åren.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska i både tal och skrift.



  





**Placeringsort:** 
 Sundbyberg
 



**Omfattning:** 
 Heltid på plats i kundens lokaler.
 



**Start:** 
 Augusti 2024, väldigt långsiktigt uppdrag.
 



  





**Information:** 



* ***Säkerhetsprövning och registerkontroll utförs på kundens begäran.***
* ***Ansök senast 2024-07-12***
* ***Urval av kandidater sker löpande och annonsen kan tas bort tidigare.***



  





**Om Agiremus** 




 Sedan 2015 har vi hjälpt flertalet medarbetare att komma ut på arbetsmarknaden samt att nå sina karriärmål runtom i Sverige. Genom att skapa och bibehålla meningsfulla relationer med våra samarbetspartners kan vi presentera en bred rad av arbetsmarknadens mest attraktiva karriärmöjligheter för våra medarbetare och kandidater. Agiremus verkar inom de flesta branscherna, både inom privat och offentlig sektor.
 



  





 Vi erbjuder:
 



 Agiremus erbjuder dig som konsult en spännande och utmanande arbetsplats där du ges möjlighet att utvecklas inom din roll. Vi bryr oss om dig som och strävar efter långsiktiga samarbeten. Som konsult hos oss ges du, förutom spännande uppdrag, möjlighet att dela din resa med andra konsulter. Med jämna mellanrum anordnar vi tillfällen för er att träffas genom olika aktiviteter. Självklart kommer du även att ha en engagerad kontaktperson hos oss som finns där som bollplank och stöd. Vi erbjuder dig även goda personalförmåner som:
 



  




* Anställning med fast månadslön.
* Semester enligt semesterlagen.
* Tjänstepension.
* Heltäckande sjuk och olycksfallsförsäkring dygnet runt, årets alla dagar.
* Friskvårdsbidrag m.m.



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Upphandlare
description:
***Är du intresserad av att projektleda upphandlingar av varierande komplexitet i en spännande bransch? Är du en fena på att ta fram affärsmässig kravställning som blir till verklig nytta för våra resenärer och främjar utvecklingen i Stockholm-Mälardalen?***
***Nu söker vi en upphandlare med vana av att leda varierande upphandlingsprojekt inom offentlig sektor. Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag.***
 Om oss
   

  

 Mälardalstrafik är det lilla bolaget med det stora uppdraget som ansvarar för varumärkena Movingo och Mälartåg. Med cirka 1 miljon resande i månaden på Mälartåg runt om i hela Mälardalen, är vi en viktig samhällsaktör och en del i ett sammanhållet kollektivtrafiksystem. Vårt uppdrag är att erbjuda ett enkelt och attraktivt resande och bidra till en hållbar utveckling i en växande Stockholm-Mälarregion. Våra kunder är arbetspendlare, studenter och fritidsresenärer och vårt marknadsområde täcker hälften av befolkningen och arbetstillfällena i Sverige.
   

  

 Bolaget har under de senaste åren genomgått en utvecklingsresa och växt till följd av utökat uppdrag i ansvar, omsättning och i antalet medarbetare. Det utökade ansvaret och uppdraget ställer krav på såväl samverkan som en affärsorienterad och effektiv förvaltning. Vår kärnverksamhet är indelad i två avdelningar, Kund och biljett samt Trafik och infrastruktur. Till detta har vi ett antal gemensamma funktioner så som ekonomi, HR och juridik.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en erfaren upphandlare som vill vara med och skapa förutsättningar för framtidens regionaltågstrafik i ett växande Stockholm-Mälardalen.
   

  

 Uppdraget
   

  

 Som upphandlare hos oss kommer du ha en viktig roll i att säkerställa att upphandlingar inom bolaget genomförs enligt plan och att de uppfyller så väl legala krav som är affärsmässigt utformade. Upphandlingar inom bolaget är varierande i omfattning och storlek och dina arbetsuppgifter kommer också innefatta att samordna förstudier och utredningar inför kommande upphandlingar.
   

  

 Uppdraget är i hög grad samverkande där du i dialog med berörda intressenter och sakkunniga såväl inom bolaget som bland våra ägarregioner och relevanta partners säkerställer framdrift, fångar och fastställer krav samt förankrar process och resultat. Du driver dina projekt självständigt och ansvarar över framtagande av projektplan som leder workshops, projektmöten och sammanställer underlag till styrgrupp för rapportering, beslut eller prioriteringar.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har högskoleutbildning eller motsvarande inom juridik, ekonomi eller annan relevant inriktning samt gedigen arbetslivserfarenhet inom upphandling. Det är viktigt att du har goda kunskaper om de upphandlingsrättsliga regelverken och erfarenhet av att arbeta med upphandlingsverktyget TendSign. Du behöver även ha goda kunskaper i MS Office eller likvärdigt program. Flytande kommunikation på svenska, både i tal och skrift, är ett krav.
   

  

 Du är en driven projektledare, med beprövad förmåga att framgångsrikt leda omfattande tvärfunktionella upphandlingsprojekt där god samverkan är en nyckelfaktor för att lyckas. Din strategiska och analytiska förmåga är hög, vilket tillsammans med ditt systematiska arbetssätt hjälper dig i att strukturera, planera och driva projekt. Det är meriterande om du tidigare har arbetat med upphandlingsprojekt inom kollektivtrafikbranschen och/eller IT-upphandlingar av varierande komplexitet.
   

  

 Din personlighet präglas av engagemang och lyhördhet för de du interagerar med och du drivs av att göra bra affärer. Du kommer verka i en strategiskt ledande roll vilket ställer krav på goda ledarskap-, och samarbetsförmågor. För oss innebär det att du har förmåga att skapa gemensam förståelse och samsyn kring problembild, lösning och förväntad effekt, du är prestigelös i din framtoning och har god pedagogisk förmåga.
   

  

 Du kan hantera perioder med högt tempo samtidigt som du klarar av att prioritera ditt arbete och säkerställa leverans med hög kvalitet. Om du dessutom är intresserad av samhällsfrågor tror vi att du kommer trivas i rollen som upphandlare hos oss. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vårt erbjudande
   

  

 Vår vision är att vara navet i en livskraftig Stockholm-Mälarregion med Sveriges mest pålitliga regionaltågstrafik. Vår värdegrund bygger på tre värderingar som genomsyrar hela vår verksamhet och guidar oss i vår vardag: Vi skapar samhällsnytta - Vi är omsorgsfulla - Vi gör det möjligt!
   

  

 I dag är vi ett 30-tal medarbetare som sitter i ljusa och fina kontorslokaler i direkt anslutning till Stockholms centralstation. Majoriteten av din arbetstid är på kontoret, du har möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån när det passar arbetsuppgifterna och uppdraget.
   

  

 Vi uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och arbetar ständigt med att utveckla våra arbetssätt och metoder. Hos oss erbjuds du utmanande och omväxlande arbetsuppgifter där du tillsammans med kunniga och engagerade kollegor skapar värde och bidrar till att uppfylla vårt kundlöfte –
 *En reseupplevelse att längta till!*
 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Ansökan sker via formulär, bifoga CV och ansökan. För att matchningen oss emellan ska bli så bra som möjligt har vi valt att jobba med rekryteringstester i vår urvalsprocess. Testerna hjälper oss att kunna matcha rätt person med rätt jobb. På detta sätt ökar vi chansen för att du som blir anställd kommer att trivas hos oss och att du har rätt förutsättningar för att lyckas i din roll.
   

  

 Eventuella frågor om ansökningsprocess eller tjänsten besvaras av HR-chef Pernilla Graff
   

  

 pernilla.graff@malardalstrafik.se
   

  

 Varje enskild medarbetare är oerhört viktig för att vi skall lyckas med vårt uppdrag. Av den anledningen lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper när vi rekryterar. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. Det är en heltidstjänst med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/8 | Publicerat: 2024-07-08 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-25

title: Senior Business Data Analyst
description:
Om tjänsten
   

  

**Har du en passion för data och hållbarhet? Vill du ha en viktig roll i energiomställningen? Vi letar nu efter en Senior Business Data Analyst till vårt dynamiska team inom Vattenfall Värme Sverige!**
 Som Senior Business Data Analyst kommer du att ha en viktig roll i att analysera komplex data för att förbättra vår verksamhet, strategiska beslutsfattande och värdet av vår tekniska data. Du kommer att arbeta med våra experter inom BI och IT-arkitektur och identifiera trender, prognostisera efterfrågan och optimera vår tjänsteleverans i tätt samarbete med tvärfunktionella. Du fungerar också som en länk till vårt internationella team inom data, analys och rapportering.
   

  

 Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Hantera olika intressenter och gränssnitt till alla organisatoriska enheter som efterfrågar avancerad dataanalys utförd på vår asset information.
* Säkerställa vidareutveckling och implementering av samordnande dataprocessflöden och matematiska modeller för att uppfylla krav på rapportering och generera användbara insikter.
* Lokalisera och definiera nya möjligheter till processförbättringar.
* Inspirera verksamheten inom avancerad dataanalys och leda genomförandet av projekt inom dataanalys.
* Främja användandet av centrala data warehouse- och visualiseringslösningar samt anpassa dem till behoven inom Värme Sverige.
* Stötta relevanta affärsprocesser (miljörapportering, skatteprocesser, datatillförsel till myndigheter mm) och konsultera kring relaterade uppgifter med tillhandahållare och mottagare av data.
* Utveckla och strukturera uppgifter för hantering av asset information för BU Värme Sverige samt säkerställa att dessa uppfylls nationellt.


 Din bakgrund
   

  

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet i liknande roll; erfarenhet inom rapportering av teknisk information är särskilt meriterande.
* Akademisk examen inom ingenjörsvetenskap, matematik, datavetenskap eller likande område.
* Kunskap om affärsmässiga processer inom energibranschen och intresse för aktuell utveckling inom energimarknaden (energiomställning, värmeöverföring, sektorkoppling).
* Kunskap om MS Azure eller liknande molnteknik samt MS PowerBI.
* Goda analytiska färdigheter och förmåga att samla, organisera, analysera och sprida en betydande mängd information (tekniska tidsserier) med fokus på detaljer och noggrannhet.
* Erfarenhet inom projektledning eller som konsult.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, i tal och skrift.


 Mer information
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Förutom att du får vara med och forma framtidens smarta energisamhälle erbjuder vi dig ett utvecklande och omväxlande arbete med många kontaktytor. För oss på Vattenfall är det viktigt att arbete och privatliv har en god balans, därför erbjuder vi flexibilitet i arbetet samt möjlighet till att arbeta hemifrån vid behov. Vi har även en hel del andra personalförmåner som exempelvis arbetstidsförkortning, förmånliga tjänstepensionsavtal, föräldraledighetstillägg med mera. Läs mer om våra förmåner här.
   

  

**Placeringsort:** 
 Solna, Uppsala eller Nyköping.
   

  

**För mer information** 
 om själva tjänsten kontakta rekryterande chef Steffen Hartwig, steffen.hartwig@vattenfall.com. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta rekryterare Cecilia Wijkman,cecilia.wijkman@vattenfall.com
   

  

 Fackliga representanter är Stefan Andersson (Akademikerna), Kjell Karlsson (Ledarna), Jan Svensson (SEKO) och Patrik Nenzen (Unionen). Du når samtliga via Vattenfalls växel, 08 739 50 00.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan senast 19 augusti 2024.** 
 Urval och intervjuer sker efter sista ansökningsdatum. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vår webbplats.
   

  

 Vi är övertygade om att mångfald bidrar till att bygga ett mer lönsamt och tilltalande företag och strävar efter att vara goda förebilder när det gäller mångfald. Vattenfall arbetar aktivt för att alla medarbetare ska ha samma möjligheter och rättigheter oavsett ålder, etnisk eller kulturell bakgrund, könstillhörighet, religion/tro, sexuell läggning eller funktionsförutsättning. Läs mer om hur vi arbetar med mångfald och inkludering här.
   

  

 Då säkerheten för Vattenfall och dess anställda är avgörande kommer vi innan varje anställning genomföra en ”pre-employment screening”. Dessa kontroller baseras på din roll som du kommer att fylla inom Vattenfall.
   

  

 Vattenfall är en del av Sveriges kritiska infrastruktur, därmed är många av våra tjänster säkerhetsklassade. Är denna tjänst säkerhetsklassad kommer säkerhetsprövning genomföras innan anställning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Om oss
   

  

 Vattenfall är en av Europas största producenter och återförsäljare av el och värme. Våra huvudmarknader är Sverige, Tyskland, Nederländerna, Danmark och Storbritannien. Inom Vattenfallkoncernen finns cirka 21 000 anställda. Vi har elektrifierat industrier, levererat energi till bostäder och förvandlat tillvaron genom innovation i över hundra års tid. Vi vill nu göra det möjligt att leva fossilfritt inom en generation och vi driver på övergången till ett hållbart energisystem.
   

  

 I Sverige levererar Vattenfall Värme fjärrvärme, fjärrkyla och ånga till industrier, fastighetsägare och bostadskunder i femton kommuner.  Vi levererar hållbar uppvärmning till cirka 200 000 svenska hushåll samt värme, kyla och ånga till industrikunder. Vi arbetar aktivt enligt en tydlig plan för att minska fossila utsläpp i våra städer, vår egen värmeproduktion och från våra leverantörer, med målet att nå nettonollutsläpp år 2040. Att vår huvudprodukt fjärrvärme spelar en så viktig roll i energiomställningen och det nya cirkulära samhället är vi extra stolta över.

title: Head of Portfolio Management, Leading Others - Nordics
description:
**Job ID: 24753**
 Would you like to join a leadership team?In Sanctions Change, we take pride working together as a team, supporting each other on our individual commitments while having fun, transferring knowledge and care about each other along the way We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Head of Portfolio Management to lead our team and help shape the future of our portfolio management operations.
 





  
 





 In today’s world, change is the one thing you can count on, and that is where you come in. Leading the way with a team of professionals and dedicated colleagues in an exciting, fast-paced environment, creating great solutions that meet the expectations that Nordea has towards its stakeholders and at the same time meet the needs of our customers. If that sounds like you, and you’re looking for a career change and/or a new area to broaden your knowledge, look no further!
 





  

  



 At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger. 
   

  





**About this opportunity**




 Welcome to the Project Management team.Sanctions Change unit is a sub unit in the Sanctions Unit, Group Financial Crime Prevention. We add value by handling any sanctions changes in Nordea, whether it is through programs, projects or agile. Our mission is to enable to spot any financial crime exposure which will then form part of a feedback loop to strengthen Nordea’s capability to manage its financial crime risk. Ultimately, your role contributes to keeping Nordea and its customers and society safer. As Head of Portfolio Management, Leading Others - Nordics you’ll be responsible to lead a team of highly competent Project Managers and Epic Owners and engage across the length and breadth of the sanctions to secure we achieve the right outcomes for the organization. 
 





  
 





 This is a strategic leadership role that requires a a deep understanding of the Financial Services Industry, Financial Crime Prevention and the services & technologies that support it, strong analytical skills and the ability to drive results in a fast-paced environment where you will be accountable for the Portfolio of all Sanctions related change initiatives.
 





  
 





 You will be expected to be able to achieve results through others as well as to have a strong grasp of sanctions, understanding industry best practice and regulatory expectations and help Nordea to build sustainable capability in the area. You will report to Head of Sanctions Change and is expected to contribute together on the strategic change agenda while ensuring that the team are delivering according to expectations.
 





  
 





 We are passionate, professional and focused on doing the right thing. 
 





  

  



**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Lead and manage a team of change professionals, fostering a collaborative and high-performance culture
* Provide oversight and data driven insights as to the investment decisions made in relation to portfolio roadmap items, facilitating decision making in relation to future investment choices
* Collaborate with other units both within Sanctions as well as the wider GFCP and business to secure portfolio alignment
* Oversee selection, priotization and execution of initiatives to ensure alignment with business goals
* Ensure the portfolio is up to date, monitor and evaluate initiative performance, making data-driven decisions to optimize outcomes
* Identify and mitigate risks across the initiative portfolio
* Be responsible for the portfolio priotization and provide updates to key stakeholders and relevant fora
* Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders
* Support the Sanctions Change unit to conduct their day to day work as well as the broader sanctions value chain and Sanctions LT in their day to day work
* Present complex material to stakeholders pitched appropriately to their seniority and level of understanding and supporting others to do so
* Create material for governance fora, ie portfolio status, capacity, roadmaps etc
* Interacting closely with colleagues and stakeholders within Group Financial Crime Prevention, IT, Group Financial Crime Compliance and Business Areas
* You will report to the Head of Sanctions Change, be a part of Sanctions Change Leadership Team and be a part of GFCP Sanctions Extended Leadership Team



  
 





 You will be part of a capability build in this area working with team members located in Finland, Sweden and Denmark. The role is based in Helsinki; Stockholm; Tallinn.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 





  
 





 To build a successful career with us, you’ll work well with others and always act with the customer’s needs in mind. You love learning and trying new things, and you’re excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You’re honest and dependable, willing to speak up even when it’s difficult, and committed to empowering others. You’re passionate about doing a great job. This is a position that offers real career growth possibilities.
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Have a strong leadership and team management skills, achieving results through others
* Have an Excellent analytical, problem-solving and decision-making abilities
* Are driven and keen to build a high performing culture and develop others further
* Are used to working with and managing diverse stakeholder with divergent needs
* Are open, honest, structured and act as a role model for others
* Own and drive your work and that of others within the team with minimal supervision
* Have experience of building influence beyond your team and across the value chain



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* Exposure to a range of delivery methodologies and change environments
* Experience from working in Financial Crime
* Experience working closely with Sanctions is a plus
* Extensive experience of planning and executing complex tasks both for yourself and for a team
* An ability to work with ambiguity, problem solve and structure the unstructured
* Securing effective communication from a team and communicating upwards into leadership
* Strong English language communication skills (oral and written)



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 22/07/2024
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Madeleine Wahlberg via email (madeleine.wahlberg@nordea.com).
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Finland: A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered. 
 





  
 





 Only for candidates in Sweden: For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.

title: Managing Director, Trilogy (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Trilogy. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 The professional services industry is undergoing a rapid transformation, driven by the need for increased efficiency and innovation. Despite the proliferation of AI tools, many organizations still grapple with manual workflows, slow customer feedback loops, and the challenge of building a distinct market presence. Data shows that companies implementing AI-driven productivity improvements can see up to a 40% increase in efficiency, yet only a small fraction have successfully integrated these advancements into their operations.
   

  

 At Trilogy, we are reimagining the role of AI in professional services by focusing on generative AI to streamline processes and enhance customer engagement. This approach not only drives significant productivity gains but also ensures our solutions are at the forefront of technological innovation. Our commitment to leveraging the latest advancements in AI sets us apart and creates a dynamic, impactful work environment.
   

  

 This role is not your typical CEO track focused on developing pie-in-the-sky strategies or schmoozing investors. Instead, you will spearhead AI-driven productivity improvements, interact directly with customers to gather and implement feedback, and work towards automating an entire organization. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on using cutting-edge technology to drive business impact and excels in a fast-paced, customer-centric environment.
   

  

 As part of our team, you will have the unique opportunity to drive productivity and customer engagement across over 100 software products, all while bypassing the usual internal logistics of a traditional CEO role. If you are passionate about AI, eager to make a significant impact, and excited about building your brand, we encourage you to apply and join us on this transformative journey.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Implementing AI-driven Productivity Improvements: Utilizing generative AI tools to streamline and automate various workflows across the organization.
* Customer Engagement and Feedback: Interacting with customers to gather insights and feedback, and using this information to enhance product offerings.
* Develop a Personal Monopoly: Publishing podcast episodes and blog posts and building a social media following to evangelize your portfolio's AI-driven products.


**Managing Director Key Responsibilities**
* Transform a large professional services organization through the innovative use of generative AI


**Basic Requirements**
* At least 8 years of work experience in a professional services organization
* Experience using generative AI tools to achieve quantifiable productivity improvements
* Currently based in North America, South America, or Europe


**About Trilogy**
 Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
