 As part of the P&C organization, Core HR works globally and collaborates to bring professional teams together to address complex issues relating to the organization’s transformation, end-to-end employee lifecycles, effective talent deployment and mobility. We bring value through evolving Communities of Expertise (CoE) to prioritize and develop solutions together with the business P&C representatives, that support the business strategy and objectives as well as to deliver Scania’s transformation journey.
   

  

 The collective goal of P&C is to empower Business Partners and Managers to ask better questions and develop comprehensive, innovative solutions that deliver quality results.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
 We are making significant investments to assemble a global team with the right skills. Joining now means seizing opportunities that come with a new operating model that will shape and influence the future.
   

  

 You'll collaborate with inspiring individuals who bring out your best, cultivate new and diverse skill sets through access to emerging technology, and learning platforms.
   

  

 You'll encounter our diverse and inclusive culture. We believe that in this rapidly evolving environment, only teams that achieve peak performance by leveraging diverse perspectives can truly thrive.
   

  

**About The Job**
 As the Head of Global and Executive Compensation, you will drive and co-ordinate a team of highly experienced professionals and have an important role in securing Scania as an employer of choice to attract and retain skilled people in a highly competitive environment. You will be responsible to articulate and implement contemporary and strategic total reward philosophies and program to reflect the organization’s purpose, vision, culture and values.
   

  

 In this position, you'll have direct responsibility for, and together with the Head People Business Partners, executive and workforce compensation, as well as global executive position grading. Your role involves overseeing, establishing, and enhancing financially optimized, sustainable and competitive programs. Regular interactions with Heads of Business Areas in P&C, Finance, Business Control, and TRATON Group/brands is anticipated.
   

  

 You and your teams responsibilities encompasses leading and coordinating a cross-functional team within the Compensation Community of Expertise (CoE) to pinpoint opportunities for process enhancements and efficiency gains relating to global compensation, job grading, reporting as well as the annual salary review. You and the team will monitor the effectiveness of existing compensation policies, guidelines and procedures.
   

  

 What we are looking for
   

  

  

* Leadership experience and deep technical knowledge of contemporary, innovative and compensation strategies and policies;
* Demonstrated ability to translate business needs into practical and implementable reward solutions;
* A proven track record of working with compensation topics, projects and implementations in a global context;
* Proven ability to manage complex stakeholder relationships;
* Knowledge of compensation best-practice, relevant employment legislation and regulations; and
* Excellent communication and advisory skills.


 If you are willing to “roll up your sleeves” and you are comfortable to pivot between the strategic and tactical this role is a great opportunity to take ownership and apply your specialized skills in a great company that has a great culture.
   

  

 The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by Scania or by their external third party provider.
   

  

**Apply now… we’re over 55, 000 perspectives globally and we’re ready to welcome yours.**
 At our core, diversity and inclusiveness (D&I – Skills Capture) define our identity, guide our work, and shape our values. We are collectively dedicated to fostering an environment where every difference is respected, practices are fair, and everyone feels a sense of belonging. We inspire individuals to collaborate and lead inclusively in their daily interactions. We welcome applications from individuals of all ages, nationalities, abilities, cultures, sexual orientations, and gender identities. Our commitment is to ensure an equitable recruitment process and work environment for all.
   

  

 For More information
   

  

 For further information about the position please contact Michele Gellatly, michele.gellatly@scania.com or Leena Khalid, leena.khalid@scania.com
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Senior Associate / Manager, Transaction Advisory (Financial Due Diligence)
description:
**Senior Associate / Manager, Transaction Advisory (Financial Due Diligence)** 




**Global Transaction Advisory Group** 




**Alvarez & Marsal** 




**Stockholm** 




  





**About us** 




 Alvarez & Marsal (“A&M”) is a global consulting firm with more than $3+ billion in revenues, c.9,000+ staff and over 80 offices worldwide. We offer a broad range of professional services including Restructuring, Transaction Advisory, Performance Improvement, Corporate Transformation, Financial Institutions Advisory, Tax, Valuations, and Disputes and Investigation Services.
 



  





 We would like to invite you to join Alvarez & Marsal’s dynamic Transaction Advisory team. Our award-winning practice includes over 1,000 professionals in over 40 offices across the United States, Middle East, Europe, Latin America, India and Asia Pacific. We work for premium clients on a selection of deals sector wide. Our Transactions Advisory team have established Alvarez & Marsal as one of the leading providers of financial due diligence globally and the leading firm to develop a fulfilling career in Transaction Advisory.
 



  





 Alvarez & Marsal’s employees benefit from joining a large network and employee resource groups such as supporting the LGBQT+ community, A&M Young Professionals, EMEA Women’s Network, The Multicultural Network, A&M Parents & Carers Community Group and offering support to those who identify as neurodivergent. Other benefits include but are not limited to flexible working, maternity / paternity leave and access to our Employee Assistance Programme. We are committed to creating a welcoming, diverse and inclusive environment for everyone.
 



  





**Our values** 




 Alvarez & Marsal’s core values lead the day-to-day decision-making practices, we work hard to uphold these values and remain true to our ethos of:
 


* *Integrity*
* *Objectivity*
* *Quality*
* *Inclusive Diversity*
* *Fun*
* *Personal Reward*



  





**What we do** 




 A&M provides investors and lenders the answers needed to get the deal done. We combine our firm’s deep operational, industry and functional resources with quality financial accounting and tax expertise to assess key deal drivers and focus on the root cause of any critical deal issues. The largest Transaction Advisory practice outside the Big Four, our global integrated teams help private equity, hedge fund and corporate acquirers unlock value across the investment cycle.
 



  





**The role** 




 We are growing and continue to expand our established team in Stockholm, we are looking to hire a Senior Associate / Manager with experience in Transactions Advisory and who can support the Transactions Advisory team on Nordic and pan European projects.
 



 As part of our highly skilled team, the successful individual will;
 



  




* Join a growing team with strong leadership, bright, energetic people with a truly entrepreneurial spirit
* Work across the entire deal life cycle in a hands-on role, including both buy-side and sell-side work
* Benefit from more diverse and exciting career opportunities
* Deliver international projects on behalf of many of the most prominent organisations worldwide
* Work with a variety of large-cap and mid-cap PE houses, corporate clients and financial institutions providing broad industry & client exposure
* Contribute to & lead projects & work streams reporting directly to the Managing Directors or Senior Directors
* Work as part of multi-disciplinary teams in Italy and across geographies and build broad international deal experience
* Gain exposure to senior members of the team in Italy and internationally gaining ‘on the job’ learning & development in addition to established formal training programmes
* Use the commercial aspects of your financial analysis skills, in addition to analysing the key drivers and valuation considerations that drive a transaction
* Work alongside A&M’s operational and commercial professionals in combined project teams enhancing your understanding of the broader due diligence & wider deal process
* Network with our service lines and work on external marketing events to build cross- service line relationships



  





 Alvarez & Marsal is an environment that presents a real opportunity for motivated individuals as all employees are encouraged to develop their client network and grow their business development skills. Our team is rewarded in terms of an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to fast track their Transactions Advisory career. Our base salaries are highly competitive and bonuses are un-capped. Employees are rewarded for their contribution to growing both TAG and the broader business.
 



  





**Essential experience:** 



* Experience in Transaction Services (financial due diligence) at a Big 4 firm is essential
* A strong academic record and professional qualifications are helpful
* Native Swedish and fluent English is required. Additional European language skills including French, Dutch, Spanish, German or Swedish are advantageous



  





 A&M’s deep operational and industry expertise provides TAG with a unique opportunity to perform more insightful due diligence by providing an integrated and differentiated approach enabling us to deliver more value to our clients. We are free from audit conflicts and our platform is less restrictive, enabling us to operate cross-border seamlessly.
 



  





**Diversity & Inclusion** 




 A&M’s entrepreneurial culture celebrates independent thinkers and doers who can positively impact our clients and shape our industry. The collaborative environment and engaging work—guided by A&M’s core values of Integrity, Quality, Objectivity, Fun, Personal Reward, and Inclusive Diversity—are the main reasons our people love working at A&M. Inclusive Diversity means we embrace diversity, and we foster inclusiveness, encouraging everyone to bring their whole self to work each day. It runs through how we recruit, develop employees, conduct business, support clients, and partner with vendors. It is the A&M way.
 



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 It is Alvarez & Marsal’s practice to provide and promote equal opportunity in employment, compensation, and other terms and conditions of employment without discrimination because of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, sex or gender, gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, family medical history, genetic information or other protected medical condition, political affiliation, or any other characteristic protected by and in accordance with applicable laws. Employees and Applicants can find A&M policy statements and additional information by region here.
 



  





**Unsolicited Resumes from Third-Party Recruiters** 




 Please note that as per A&M policy, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters unless such recruiters are engaged to provide candidates for a specified opening and in alignment with our Inclusive Diversity values. Any employment agency, person or entity that submits an unsolicited resume does so with the understanding that A&M will have the right to hire that applicant at its discretion without any fee owed to the submitting employment agency, person or entity.

title: Systemförvaltare SimCorp Dimension hos Skandia
description:
**Vi söker en verksamhetsnära Systemförvaltare inom SimCorp Dimension, till Skandia Investment Management i Stockholm.**
 Hos Skandia Investment Management i Stockholm blir du en del av ett tight team inom kapitalförvaltning! Här får du ta stort ansvar som Systemförvaltare med SimCorp Dimension i fokus samt möjligheten att driva olika projekt inom förändring och effektivisering.
   

  

**Ditt anställningserbjudande**
 Hos oss på Skandia Investment Management kommer du att göra en verklig skillnad. Vi erbjuder dig:
   

  

* En varierad vardag att arbeta med där du får jobba med hela Dimension systemets front – back office.
* En arbetsplats där vi värdesätter engagemang och innovation.
* Stödjande och samarbetsvilliga kollegor med lång erfarenhet.
* En arbetsgivare som värnar om balans mellan privatliv och arbetsliv med fina personalförmåner; försäkringar, ränteförmåner, subventionerade luncher, gym i huset m.m.


**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
 I Rollen Som Systemförvaltare Kommer Du Att Vara Länken Som Förstår Verksamhetens Behov Och Kan Översätta Beställningar Till Färdiga Systemlösningar. I Rollen Ingår Även
   

  

* Att vara användarstöd i verksamheten samt delta i och driva effektiviseringsprojekt gällande system och processer för verksamheten.
* Förvaltning och vidareutveckling av systemen, inklusive löpande arbete med konfigurering och parametersättning
* Förvaltning av vårt huvudsystem, SimCorp Dimension, och flera av våra mindre system inom området.


**Värt att veta**
 Du blir en del av Systemadministration & IT, som består av sex personer inklusive chef. Teamet har en gedigen erfarenhet inom kapitalförvaltningens IT-frågor och ansvarar för användarsupport, projektarbete och processförbättringar. Inom teamet värdesätter vi ett nära samarbete, nyfikenhet och vilja att dela med sig av sin kunskap till varandra.
   

  

 Placering är i Stockholm Lindhagen, på vårt kontor, där vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt och du har möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån delar av veckan.
   

  

**Våra förväntningar**
 Vi söker dig som tidigare har arbetat inom en kapitalförvaltning och har sannolikt minst ett par års erfarenhet av systemförvaltning. Det är ett krav att du har mycket god kunskap i SimCorp Dimension som Systemförvaltare, eller erfarenhet från arbete inom front-, middle- eller back-office i kapitalförvaltning.
   

  

 Som person är du kommunikativ och har god samarbetsförmåga samt att du har ett prestigelöst förhållningssätt. Det är även viktigt att du är ansvarstagande och drivande, har förmågan att ta egna initiativ med fokus på att slutföra saker med kvalitet.
   

  

 Du kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Bolagsjurist
description:
***Är du intresserad av att använda din juridiska kompetens i en verksamhetsnära roll där du får arbeta brett och involvera dig i en mix av olika frågor? Drivs du av att säkerställa goda affärer som skapar möjligheter för en växande Stockholm-Mälardalsregion?***
***Låter det intressant? Fortsätt läsa, vi söker ytterligare en kollega i form av en kunnig och engagerad bolagsjurist!***
 Om oss
   

  

 Mälardalstrafik är det lilla bolaget med det stora uppdraget som ansvarar för varumärkena Movingo och Mälartåg. Med cirka 1 miljon resande i månaden på Mälartåg runt om i hela Mälardalen, är vi en viktig samhällsaktör och en del i ett sammanhållet kollektivtrafiksystem. Vårt uppdrag är att erbjuda ett enkelt och attraktivt resande och bidra till en hållbar utveckling i en växande Stockholm-Mälarregion. Våra kunder är arbetspendlare, studenter och fritidsresenärer och vårt marknadsområde täcker hälften av befolkningen och arbetstillfällena i Sverige.
   

  

 Bolaget har under de senaste åren genomgått en utvecklingsresa och växt till följd av utökat uppdrag i ansvar, omsättning och i antalet medarbetare. Det utökade ansvaret och uppdraget ställer krav på såväl samverkan som en affärsorienterad och effektiv förvaltning. Vår kärnverksamhet är indelad i två avdelningar, Kund och biljett samt Trafik och infrastruktur. Till detta har vi ett antal gemensamma funktioner så som ekonomi, HR och juridik.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en erfaren Bolagsjurist som vill vara med och skapa förutsättningar för framtidens regionaltågstrafik i ett växande Stockholm-Mälardalen.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som Bolagsjurist på Mälardalstrafik kommer du stödja verksamheten med bland annat juridisk rådgivning. Det innefattar så väl strategiskt beslutsstöd, upphandlings- och förhandlingsstöd, bolagsrättsliga frågor, framtagande och granskning av kommersiella avtal samt övriga legala frågor som kan uppkomma inom bolaget. Även frågor rörande IT-rätt samt offentlighet och sekretess hanteras av juristerna i bolaget.
   

  

 Du kommer arbeta brett i en mix av stora och små juridiska frågor och du kommer till del utbilda och vägleda men framför allt ge operativt stöd i allehanda legala frågor till utformning av avtal och i förvaltningsrättsliga frågor inom bolaget. Vi befinner oss i ett utvecklingsskede där dina insatser kommer vara ett viktigt bidrag i uppbyggnad av såväl strategisk som operativ upphandlingsrättslig och avtalsrättslig kompetens inom bolaget. Vår tillväxtresa inom bolaget fortgår successivt och utöver nuvarande bemanning pågår rekrytering av chefsjurist och upphandlare till aktuell avdelning.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

* Juristexamen eller motsvarande juridisk examen inom relevant område såsom affärsjuridik, bolags- eller avtalsrätt.
* Minst tre års dokumenterad erfarenhet av kvalificerat juridiskt arbete från bolag, advokatbyrå eller myndighet/förvaltning.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataskydd och IT-rätt.
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga i både tal och skrift, på såväl svenska som engelska.


 För att lyckas i tjänsten uppfyller du högt ställda krav på affärsmässighet, omdöme och samarbetsförmåga. Då vi är ett litet bolag med ett stort uppdrag så bör du ha en prestigelös framtoning i förhållande till så väl kollegor, som uppdrag och arbetsuppgifter.
   

  

 Att kunna ta ansvar och ha förmågan att utifrån verksamhetens behov självständigt analysera, initiera, följa upp och driva det juridiska arbetet tillsammans med verksamheten är framgångsfaktorer i uppdraget. Som person är du engagerad och har en vilja att bidra och skapa mervärde. Vi förutsätter att du kan uttrycka dig väl i både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
   

  

 Du kan hantera perioder med högt tempo samtidigt som du klarar av att prioritera ditt arbete och säkerställa leverans med hög kvalitet. Om du dessutom är intresserad av samhällsfrågor tror vi att du kommer trivas i rollen som Bolagsjurist hos oss. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Vårt erbjudande
   

  

 Vår vision är att vara navet i en livskraftig Stockholm-Mälarregion med Sveriges mest pålitliga regionaltågstrafik. Vår värdegrund bygger på tre värderingar som genomsyrar hela vår verksamhet och guidar oss i vår vardag: Vi skapar samhällsnytta - Vi är omsorgsfulla - Vi gör det möjligt!
   

  

 I dag är vi ett 30-tal medarbetare som sitter i ljusa och fina kontorslokaler i direkt anslutning till Stockholms centralstation. Majoriteten av din arbetstid är på kontoret, du har möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån när det passar arbetsuppgifterna och uppdraget.
   

  

 Vi uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och arbetar ständigt med att utveckla våra arbetssätt och metoder. Hos oss erbjuds du utmanande och omväxlande arbetsuppgifter där du tillsammans med kunniga och engagerade kollegor skapar värde och bidrar till att uppfylla vårt kundlöfte –
 *En reseupplevelse att längta till!*
 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Ansökan sker via formulär, bifoga CV och ansökan. För att matchningen oss emellan ska bli så bra som möjligt har vi valt att jobba med rekryteringstester i vår urvalsprocess. Testerna hjälper oss att kunna matcha rätt person med rätt jobb. På detta sätt ökar vi chansen för att du som blir anställd kommer att trivas hos oss och att du har rätt förutsättningar för att lyckas i din roll. Tjänsten kan komma att omfatta deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet vilket innebär att en säkerhetsprövning inför anställning kan komma att genomföras.
   

  

 Eventuella frågor om ansökningsprocess eller tjänsten besvaras av HR-chef Pernilla Graff
   

  

 pernilla.graff@malardalstrafik.se
   

  

 Varje enskild medarbetare är oerhört viktig för att vi skall lyckas med vårt uppdrag. Av den anledningen lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper när vi rekryterar. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. Det är en heltidstjänst med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/6 | Kontakt: Pernilla Graff 072-4647602, | Publicerat: 2024-07-08 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-08-18

title: Finnish-speaking Account Executive
description:
**Are you the one we are looking for?** 




 We are looking for you - a Finnish-speaking salesperson who is ready to roll up your sleeves for rapid success, both for yourself and for us.
 



  





 At Tendium, you will sell our revolutionary B2B SaaS platform. We work with short sales cycles and a product that practically sells itself when you play your cards right. You have the energy and drive to take this opportunity to new heights.
 



  





 Your commission is uncapped— the sky is the limit.
 



  





 You have a self-driven attitude, are fearless, and maintain a positive outlook. We believe you are unpretentious, motivated by development, and keen on building strong relationships with our customers. If so, you will fit right in with us!
 



  





**Your personality, experience, and skills** 




 We are looking for someone with the right attitude. If you also have the right experience, that's great.
 


* You are driven, energetic, and self-reliant.
* Experience making cold calls and initiating meetings.
* You can actively listen and identify customer needs.
* You can translate needs into added value and sell a product/service.
* You can continue to perform at a high level even after getting three rejections in a row.
* You are fluent in Finnish and proficient in English. Any proficiency in Swedish is a bonus.
* Experience with CRM tools - or willingness to learn.
* 1+ years of B2B experience is a plus.
* Experience with SaaS is a plus.



  





**About the position** 




 We aim for the stars, and we are looking for someone who does too. As an Account Executive, you will sell Tendium's innovative SaaS platform across a variety of industries with Finland and the rest of Europe as your market.
 



  





 You will work in a data-driven and digital sales process where the CRM system plays a central role. Your focus will be on new customer sales, and you are expected to take responsibility for the entire sales cycle - from calling leads to signed contracts.
 



  





 If you perform well, you can reach level 2 where you will be boosted with leads from our excellent SDRs and marketing team, allowing you to focus entirely on closing more deals.
 



 We have short sales cycles, and your commission will be uncapped.
 



  





 You will report directly to our Sales Manager, and we are looking for someone who can be present in our modern office in central Stockholm.
 



  





 This is a permanent full-time position with a 6-month probationary period, fixed salary, and commission.
 



  





**In this role, you will mainly work with:** 



* New customer sales via phone and video meetings.
* Prospecting and qualifying new segments and initiating business dialogues.
* Clearly communicating the value of Tendium's services in all possible dialogues.
* Identifying and qualifying potential customers' challenges, needs, and business goals to create a "must-have" need for Tendium's services, both from a strategic, tactical, and economic perspective.
* Challenging, educating, and guiding potential customers in their sales to the public sector.
* Creating and converting your pipeline of deals – identifying, engaging, and developing relationships with potential customers.
* Actively collaborating with other teams within Tendium to close deals.



  





**About Tendium** 




 Tendium is a scale-up in the growth phase with strong investors backing us, using AI to revolutionize a traditional industry - public procurement. With a groundbreaking SaaS platform, we make it simpler, smarter, more efficient, and above all more profitable for companies to participate in public procurements. We are happy and proud to provide companies with new tools and contribute to healthy competition in public procurements with the efficient use of our tax funds as a result!
 



  





 We are a young and agile company with some of Sweden's sharpest minds. Our organisation is flat, where all employees get responsibilities early and room to grow. Since we are in a strong growth phase, new opportunities are constantly being created within the company. We are all involved in shaping Tendium and contributing to the company's development!
 



  





 This is a unique opportunity to work in an incredibly engaged team on an exciting journey. We hope to find you who want to grow and create new successes with us. With us, you will work in a driven, friendly, and open team where everyone knows each other and enjoys working together!
 



  





**Application** 




 We recruit continuously, so apply as soon as possible. You will sell through video calls, and therefore part of the application is a 2-minute video where you sell yourself.

title: Bolagsjurist
description:
*Är du intresserad av att använda din juridiska kompetens i en verksamhetsnära roll där du får arbeta brett och involvera dig i en mix av olika frågor? Drivs du av att säkerställa goda affärer som skapar möjligheter för en växande Stockholm-Mälardalsregion?* 




  





*Låter det intressant? Fortsätt läsa, vi söker ytterligare en kollega i form av en kunnig och engagerad bolagsjurist!* 




  





**Om oss** 




  





 Mälardalstrafik är det lilla bolaget med det stora uppdraget som ansvarar för varumärkena Movingo och Mälartåg. Med cirka 1 miljon resande i månaden på Mälartåg runt om i hela Mälardalen, är vi en viktig samhällsaktör och en del i ett sammanhållet kollektivtrafiksystem. Vårt uppdrag är att erbjuda ett enkelt och attraktivt resande och bidra till en hållbar utveckling i en växande Stockholm-Mälarregion. Våra kunder är arbetspendlare, studenter och fritidsresenärer och vårt marknadsområde täcker hälften av befolkningen och arbetstillfällena i Sverige.
 



  





 Bolaget har under de senaste åren genomgått en utvecklingsresa och växt till följd av utökat uppdrag i ansvar, omsättning och i antalet medarbetare. Det utökade ansvaret och uppdraget ställer krav på såväl samverkan som en affärsorienterad och effektiv förvaltning. Vår kärnverksamhet är indelad i två avdelningar, Kund och biljett samt Trafik och infrastruktur. Till detta har vi ett antal gemensamma funktioner så som ekonomi, HR och juridik.
 



  





 Nu söker vi en erfaren Bolagsjurist som vill vara med och skapa förutsättningar för framtidens regionaltågstrafik i ett växande Stockholm-Mälardalen.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter** 




  





 Som Bolagsjurist på Mälardalstrafik kommer du stödja verksamheten med bland annat juridisk rådgivning. Det innefattar så väl strategiskt beslutsstöd, upphandlings- och förhandlingsstöd, bolagsrättsliga frågor, framtagande och granskning av kommersiella avtal samt övriga legala frågor som kan uppkomma inom bolaget. Även frågor rörande IT-rätt samt offentlighet och sekretess hanteras av juristerna i bolaget.
 



  





 Du kommer arbeta brett i en mix av stora och små juridiska frågor och du kommer till del utbilda och vägleda men framför allt ge operativt stöd i allehanda legala frågor till utformning av avtal och i förvaltningsrättsliga frågor inom bolaget. Vi befinner oss i ett utvecklingsskede där dina insatser kommer vara ett viktigt bidrag i uppbyggnad av såväl strategisk som operativ upphandlingsrättslig och avtalsrättslig kompetens inom bolaget. Vår tillväxtresa inom bolaget fortgår successivt och utöver nuvarande bemanning pågår rekrytering av chefsjurist och upphandlare till aktuell avdelning.
 



  





**Kvalifikationer** 




  




* Juristexamen eller motsvarande juridisk examen inom relevant område såsom affärsjuridik, bolags- eller avtalsrätt.
* Minst tre års dokumenterad erfarenhet av kvalificerat juridiskt arbete från bolag, advokatbyrå eller myndighet/förvaltning.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataskydd och IT-rätt.
* Mycket god kommunikativ förmåga i både tal och skrift, på såväl svenska som engelska.



  





 För att lyckas i tjänsten uppfyller du högt ställda krav på affärsmässighet, omdöme och samarbetsförmåga. Då vi är ett litet bolag med ett stort uppdrag så bör du ha en prestigelös framtoning i förhållande till så väl kollegor, som uppdrag och arbetsuppgifter.
 



  





 Att kunna ta ansvar och ha förmågan att utifrån verksamhetens behov självständigt analysera, initiera, följa upp och driva det juridiska arbetet tillsammans med verksamheten är framgångsfaktorer i uppdraget. Som person är du engagerad och har en vilja att bidra och skapa mervärde. Vi förutsätter att du kan uttrycka dig väl i både svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.
 



  





 Du kan hantera perioder med högt tempo samtidigt som du klarar av att prioritera ditt arbete och säkerställa leverans med hög kvalitet. Om du dessutom är intresserad av samhällsfrågor tror vi att du kommer trivas i rollen som Bolagsjurist hos oss. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
 



  





**Vårt erbjudande** 




  





 Vår vision är att vara navet i en livskraftig Stockholm-Mälarregion med Sveriges mest pålitliga regionaltågstrafik. Vår värdegrund bygger på tre värderingar som genomsyrar hela vår verksamhet och guidar oss i vår vardag: Vi skapar samhällsnytta - Vi är omsorgsfulla - Vi gör det möjligt!
 



  





 I dag är vi ett 30-tal medarbetare som sitter i ljusa och fina kontorslokaler i direkt anslutning till Stockholms centralstation. Majoriteten av din arbetstid är på kontoret, du har möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån när det passar arbetsuppgifterna och uppdraget.
 



  





 Vi uppmuntrar till kompetensutveckling och arbetar ständigt med att utveckla våra arbetssätt och metoder. Hos oss erbjuds du utmanande och omväxlande arbetsuppgifter där du tillsammans med kunniga och engagerade kollegor skapar värde och bidrar till att uppfylla vårt kundlöfte –
 *En reseupplevelse att längta till!* 




  





**Välkommen med din ansökan!** 




  





 Ansökan sker via formulär, bifoga CV och ansökan. För att matchningen oss emellan ska bli så bra som möjligt har vi valt att jobba med rekryteringstester i vår urvalsprocess. Testerna hjälper oss att kunna matcha rätt person med rätt jobb. På detta sätt ökar vi chansen för att du som blir anställd kommer att trivas hos oss och att du har rätt förutsättningar för att lyckas i din roll. Tjänsten kan komma att omfatta deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet vilket innebär att en säkerhetsprövning inför anställning kan komma att genomföras.
 



  





 Eventuella frågor om ansökningsprocess eller tjänsten besvaras av HR-chef Pernilla Graff
 



 pernilla.graff@malardalstrafik.se
 



  





 Varje enskild medarbetare är oerhört viktig för att vi skall lyckas med vårt uppdrag. Av den anledningen lägger vi stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper när vi rekryterar. Vi tillämpar sex månaders provanställning. Det är en heltidstjänst med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Intervjuer sker löpande.

title: Support Technician to world renowned video game studio
description:
Are you a tech-savvy problem solver with a passion for gaming? Are you ready to take your skills to the next level and make a real impact? We're now on the lookout for passionate individuals with experience within IT-support to become a part of our client's growing family. Here is a chance to turn your technical skills and love for gaming into a rewarding profession. Are you up for the challenge? Keep reading to discover more about this exciting opportunity!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, 18 month contract
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 We're now looking for a Support Technician to our client; a Microsoft-owned, global and leading company within the video game industry. As a Support Technician here, you'll have the chance to combine your love for gaming with your technical prowess to provide top-tier assistance to colleagues.
 


  


 To help them achieve amazing things, they have built an equally amazing studio space. Situated right by the water, it’s filled to the brim with all the tools, toys and caffeine required to create world-class entertainment. But in the end, it’s the people of the company that make them truly special. When you join, you’ll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals – all united and working toward a single goal.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* An opportunity to work behind the scenes of one of the world's most beloved games
  
* A supportive and inclusive work environment
  
* The chance to grow your career in the gaming industry
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Be our client's front line for technical improvements across the studio, including desktop support troubleshooting hardware and software issues
  
* Perform IT-related tasks for the on and off-boarding process (PC build-out, dev kit setup, etc.)
  
* Identify, advocate for, and implement changes for the IT helpdesk process workflows based on studio requirements
  
* Work the Xbox Game Studios IT and Microsoft IT on both tactical (day-to-day) and strategic (long-term) projects
  
* Lead the effort to evaluate and recommend hardware for various disciplines across the studio
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Experience with an ITIL process-based helpdesk system
  
* Experience in JIRA Service Desk or comparable helpdesk systems
  
* Experience with Microsoft corporate environments such as Active Directory or SharePoint
  
* Knowledge of authentication, basic network and printers and related common issues
  
* Fluent in English, both in writing and verbally
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have:**



  

  
* IT Operations/Engineering experience with a Game Studio
  
* Experience writing code/scripts in C# or PowerShell
  
* Experience troubleshooting client related issues in a Microsoft Corporate environment and the restrictions that comes with said environment
  


  


 To succeed in the role, we see that you are service-minded with a positive attitude, a problem solver and communicative as a person.
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Nils Norgren or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth2@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105729

title: Erfaren IT-tekniker till myndighet utöver det vanliga!
description:
Är du en driven och serviceinriktad IT-tekniker med erfarenhet inom support och teknisk felsökning? Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär och bli en del av en dynamisk IT-enhet i centrala Stockholm? Då är detta den perfekta tjänsten för dig!
 


  


 Vår kund erbjuder en unik möjlighet för en IT-tekniker att arbeta i en hybridroll som kombinerar både helpdesk-support och tekniskt arbete. Du kommer att ingå i ett dedikerat team och ha en central roll i att säkerställa att organisationens medarbetare får den support och de tekniska lösningar de behöver för att utföra sitt arbete effektivt.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 September 2024
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Det här är en roll för dig med minst tre års erfarenhet av rollen som IT support och som är redo att ta nästa steg i karriären. Din arbetsdag kommer att vara varierad och fylld av spännande utmaningar, cirka 60% av tiden kommer du vara dedikerad till first- och second-line IT-support. Resterande 40% av din tid kommer du att fokusera på mer tekniska uppgifter. Du kommer att ansvara för installation och felsökning av både hård- och mjukvara, hantera konton i Active Directory och Exchange, samt administrera och underhålla vår videokonferensutrustning. Därtill ingår även administration av mobiltelefonabonnemang.
 


  


 Uppdraget startar i september 2024 och löper till och med augusti 2025, med möjlighet till förlängning i ytterligare sex månader. Rollen är på heltid och du kommer att vara baserad på vår kunds kontor i centrala Stockholm, med vissa möjligheter till distansarbete. Vår kund värdesätter en arbetsmiljö där du kan växa och utvecklas, du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med ett kunnigt och engagerat team som stöttar varandra och arbetar mot gemensamma mål.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Ett stimulerande och varierande arbete i en arbetsmiljö där varje dag bjuder på nya utmaningar och möjligheter.
  
* Ett nära samarbete med kunniga och engagerade kollegor i ett mindre team.
  
* En dedikerad och engagerad konsultchef.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Ge first- och second-line IT-support till medarbetare via personliga möten, telefon, e-post och Teams.
  
* Hantera och felsöka hård- och mjukvara.
  
* Administrera konton i Active Directory och Exchange.
  
* Ansvara för installation och underhåll av videokonferensutrustning.
  
* Administrera mobiltelefonabonnemang.
  
* Arbeta i ärendehanteringssystemet Easit.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Minst tre års aktuell erfarenhet som IT-supporttekniker.
  
* Erfarenhet av kontohantering i Active Directory och Exchange.
  
* Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i ett ärendehanteringssystem.
  
* Erfarenhet av videokonferensutrustning.
  
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Intune.
  
* Erfarenhet av Microsoft Configuration Manager
  
* Erfarenhet av IT-support inom offentlig sektor (starkt meriterande).
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Hjälpsam
  
* Stresstolerant
  
* Ansvarstagande
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Filippa Danell Karlberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på filippa.karlberg@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105539

title: Turnpikes söker utvecklare!
description:
Är du passionerad inom IT och söker nya utmaningar? Turnpikes erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans med ett team av engagerade kollegor. Välkommen till ett företag i framkant av teknik och innovation!
 


  

  

  

  


  

**Företag :**
 Turnpikes Sweden Filial
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Turnpikes är en talangfull grupp människor med huvudkontor i Danmark men verksamma över hela världen, som möjliggör digital transformation för företagskunder. Turnpikes värdesätter sina starka relationer, strävar alltid efter att skapa värde och är stolta över sin extremt höga kundnöjdhet från några av världens största företag.
 


  


 Med en ständigt växande kundbas har behovet av ytterligare expansion blivit tydligt. Nu söker vi utvecklare som i en bred roll kommer få ta stort ansvar gentemot den svenska kundbasen. Du kommer att arbeta med tekniska uppgifter relaterade till OpenText Extended ECM (Enterprise Content Management) och leverera kvalitativa konfigurationer till projektteamet som definierar omfattningen och interagerar med slutkunden.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En fot in på ett företag vars tillväxtstrategi är ambitiös och där du får utrymme att växa i karriären
  
* Tydliga utvecklingsplaner och en platt struktur som ger dig tillgång till en stor kunskapsbas
  
* Möjlighet att arbeta med banbrytande teknologi och branschledande lösningar
  
* Omfattande förmånspaket
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Arbeta med definierade uppgifter i OpenText Extended ECM, som Web Reports, arbetsflöden, arkivhantering, etc.
  
* Leverera hög kvalitet i konfigurationer, utvecklingar och relaterad dokumentation.
  
* Samarbeta i ett större projektteam och kommunicera med dina kollegor på olika platser i världen.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en relevant universitetsutbildning inom IT
  
* Har en god generell teknisk förståelse
  
* Har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
  
* Har grundläggande erfarenhet av databashantering
  
* Kan kommunicera väl på både svenska och engelska
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Stresstolerant
  
* Målmedveten
  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Intellektuellt nyfiken
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Turnpikes Sweden Filial**

 Här kan du läsa mer om Turnpikes.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Turnpikes Sweden Filial**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stw07@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105555

title: IT tekniker sökes till spännande bolag i centrala Stockholm
description:
**Vi söker nu en IT-tekniker med erfarenhet till en av våra kunder inom förnybar energi som befinner sig i en expansiv fas. I denna roliga och varierande roll får du arbeta nära en dynamisk IT enhet och ta hand om både första- och andra linjens support samt onsite-support. Detta är en fantastisk möjlighet att komma in på ett framgångsrikt bolag, vilket innebär spännande utmaningar och personlig utveckling.**
**Din vardag:**
 I denna roll kommer du att ha en spännande vardag där du får möjlighet att förkovra dig i informationsteknik. Du kommer bland annat att:
   

  

* Ge första- och andra linjens support, både on-site och via ärendehanteringssystem
* Installera och hantera hårdvara och mjukvara
* Supportera switchar, skrivare och konferensrum


**Vi söker dig som**
* Har minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete som IT tekniker i liknande roller
* Har arbetat med både hård- och mjukvara
* Har teknisk kompetens inom Active Directory
* Har kunskap och erfarenhet av Microsoft 365 och Microsoft Office i Windows
* Talar och skriver flytande i svenska och engelska


**VI ERBJUDER**
 När du börjar hos oss som konsult på Wise IT blir du en del av vår gemenskap. Du får kollegor runt om i Sverige på alla regionala Wise IT kontor och även med våra andra konsulter som sitter ute på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Du har en dedikerad konsultchef som stötta dig och din utveckling. Vi hjälper dig hitta nya vägar genom att prova på nya roller och nya branscher, för oss är det viktigt att du trivs på din arbetsplats. Vi ser till att du hamnar på ett bra bolag under ditt uppdrag och att uppdragen ligger i linje med hur du vill utvecklas framöver. Oavsett vad det blir, står vi bakom dig hela vägen. Gå med i vårt team och ta del av en spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö! Wise IT arbetar med kompetensförsörjning inom IT. Vår uppgift är att hitta rätt person till rätt IT-jobb, genom rekrytering och konsulter. Vi tror på människan i en framtida teknikutveckling och brinner för att bygga relationer, inkludera fler i IT-branschen och naturligtvis matcha rätt kompetens till rätt uppdrag. Vi vill vara en självklar go-to career partner oavsett om kandidaten söker jobb i dagsläget eller inte. Vill du vara med på vår resa? Läs mer om oss, vår kultur och våra värderingar på vår karriärsida.
   

  

 ANSÖKAN
   

  

 Har du frågor eller funderingar får du gärna höra av dig till Marina Malesevic (marina.malesevic@wiseit.se). Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.

title: Game developer
description:
We are now looking for the best game developer to join us! You have the chance to be a part of creating the best casino games in the online slot industry!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and maintain Casino Games for both desktop and mobile browsers
* The technologies you primarily will work with are HTML5, WebGL, Typescript, Pixi, GSAP and Javascript.
* In a team environment that consists of product management, graphic artistry, sound creation, server development and game mechanics, you will contribute to deliver the best casino games in the market today.
* Your main responsibilities are to make the game graphics come alive with spectacular animations, game flow, game mechanics and sounds according to a result delivered by our game servers.


 Who you are
   

  

* You are a Master Google Searcher that have Stackoverflow as your absolute favourite web site.
* You have practical experience of working with OOP in some language and you have a pragmatic approach to software development.
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in.
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you.
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and take ownership of changes from editor to production system.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Working experience of mobile browsers and knowledge about their limitations and how they work in different ways is a big plus.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Senior IT Analyst (Application Provider) to Technology unit
description:
**Job ID: 24613**





  
 



  
 






*#Core of the core #Heart of the bank* 


  Would you like to be part of the journey to create an even better version of us? At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with financial solutions of tomorrow.  We are looking for an Application Providers to join Core Systems Sweden - a team loaded with experience, professionalism and passion. Now we need to add talent to the team, to stay in strength and competence also for the future
 









  
 









**About this opportunity** 
  
 









  
 









 Welcome to the Local Systems team. We add value by providing stable, efficient and innovative IT services in the core banking system areas such as Deposits, Payments, Customer data and Loans, serving virtually all other business areas of the bank. As an Application Provider you will play a vital role in maintaining and developing Nordea’s fundamental banking applications. You will be responsible for a portfolio of applications constituting the foundation of the bank. In your role, you will make sure Nordeas core applications are stable, compliant, well-functioning and robustly architectured over time. You will work with defining and implementing Application Lifecycle Roadmaps.
 









  
 **What you’ll be doing:** 
  
 





* Take overall ownership of the applications in Nordeas production environment
* Overlook the activities in the Change, Incident and Problem Processes
* Approve, or if needed, stop, changes to the applications in the production environment
* Conduct compliance reviews, and if needed implement corrective measures
* Cooperate with Application Owners, Development Execution Leadership and People Capabilities to create an optimal environment for the applications evolution, including access to sufficient application competence over time
* Take responsibility for the financials of the applications, managing Operations and Maintenance costs.
* Follow up on agreed service levels with all parties working with the application.



  
 






 As an Application Provider, you will focus on the applications health in a short and long term perspective, making sure Nordea has access to applications with world class functionality, scalability, maintainability and performance, now and in the future. To achieve this, you will be cooperating with many parts of Nordea, inside and outside Local Systems. Vendor Management will be a crucial activity, as many of the operational services of the applications are purchased from external vendors. The Local Systems application portfolio is mainly built on the IBM z/OS (“Mainframe”) technical platform. To be successful, we believe you are well acquainted with this platform.
 






  
 






 This role is based in SE/Stockholm. This is a permanent, full-time, position. We follow hybrid model of working.
 









  
 









**Who you are** 
  
 









  
 









 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. 
 









  
 









**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 
  
 





* Have worked at least five years with banking applications
* Have a good ability to understand large and complex system landscapes
* Are good at grasping rules and regulations, and realizing their practical consequences
* Are well acquainted with IT Operations work
* Can do financial analysis at a basic level
* Can act independently, and identify the actions you need to take.
* Have a positive attitude and cooperate easily with those you have contact with in your daily work
* Have the capability to work with English speaking colleagues from all over the world.






   
 









**Your experience and background** 
  
 





* You have at least five years of experience from software maintenance and development in the financial sector
* You are skilled in and enjoy analysing IT solutions
* Several years of experience from working with mainframe systems
* Experience from ITIL and IPC Process work
* Acquaintance with Nordeas systems, products and processes will be a big advantage




**What we offer**





  
 






 You'll join a team of highly skilled IT professionals, with a huge collective experience of banking systems. Cooperation is well established within the team, and we take a strong personal responsibility for our work. As Application Provider in Local Systems, you will be entrusted Nordeas most critical applications, placing you in the midst of Nordeas daily operations. You will be in daily cooperation with some of the best professionals in the area.
 






  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 

  
 






**Next steps** 
  
 








 Please note that we will start interviews already before job opening closes, submit your application as soon as possible, no later than 21/07/2024. For more information, you're welcome to contact Johan Larsson at johan.larsson@nordea.com.
 







 ​
 







 If you have any questions about recruitment steps you may contact our tech recruiter sanna.frisk@nordea.com.
 





  
 





 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  

  




 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

title: AI/ML Engineer
description:
**About EXANTE**
 EXANTE is a wealth tech company that provides centralized trading solutions and B2B financial infrastructure that helps create value through technology.
   

  

 Our proprietary trading platform enables direct market access to 1M financial instruments from a single multi-currency account, including stocks, ETFs, bonds, futures, and options.
   

  

 We are a fast-growing global company with 600+ employees across 70+ locations, representing 60 nationalities, all of us following the same guiding principles:
   

  

* We believe that freedom is an inherited right
* We are catalysts
* We defend privacy
* We cater to our customers to an unprecedented degree


 As a Financial company, we know our investment priorities. We invest in our people.
   

  

 Join us in creating a new standard for wealth management:https://exantecareers.com
   

  

**About The Role**
 Are you passionate about leveraging AI to transform operations in the brokerage industry? Do you thrive in dynamic environments where innovation and flexibility are paramount? Join us as an AI/ML Engineer to spearhead strategic initiatives, enhance our operations, and drive the future of brokerage technology.
   

  

 Reporting line: Head of Client Services
   

  

 Location: anywhere
   

  

 Worksite: flexible (remote/onsite)
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Assess the existing IT backlog and companywide initiatives to identify opportunities to integrate AI-driven solutions. Work closely with the IT team to understand existing systems and propose AI-driven alternatives.
* Develop strategies to integrate AI/ML solutions into our trading platforms and internal operations without compromising security.
* Utilize machine learning to alleviate pressure and streamline processes within counterparty onboarding, order categorization, client experience, client data metrics, etc.
* Develop and implement algorithms for data cleansing, preprocessing, and feature engineering.
* Utilize machine learning, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling to extract valuable insights from large datasets.
* Monitor and evaluate the performance of AI/ML models and algorithms in production and continuously iterate to improve their accuracy, efficiency, and scalability.


**Requirements**
* Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, or C++.
* Strong understanding of machine learning techniques and frameworks.
* Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation.
* Familiarity with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch or TensorFlow.
* Experience with RAG models (embedding, reranking) is a plus.
* Familiarity with developing custom AI models and algorithms.


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary & performance-based bonus programs
* Corporate benefits (choose your preferred options)
* Truly inspiring culture, pleasant and informal work environment
* Ongoing education & training programs
* Opportunity to network and connect in the Corporate Events
* Global career opportunities
* Benefits/perks listed above may vary depending on the nature of your employment with the company and the country where you work

title: Unreal / C++ Generalist
description:
**About the Company:** 




  





 Our client is looking for an experienced Unreal/C++ programmer to help bring life to a military training simulation platform. This full-time role is based in Stockholm and offers a favourable salary and exciting projects.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 




  





 You will be using Unreal Engine to build a military simulator targeting the professional market. You'll work closely with experts in aerospace and military simulations to create an immersive simulated world with complex and realistic agent behaviour and a rich pattern of life.
 



  





**Qualifications:** 




  





 To apply for this role, you will need solid professional experience as a C++ programmer, ideally within Unreal and a willingness to learn, cooperate and solve difficult problems. You will also require the following:
 



  




* US or EU-Citizenship, plus excellent professional communication skills in English
* Ability to build performant solutions
* Experience with profiling, optimising and debugging C++ code
* Background in a related field would be advantageous.



  





**Pay range and compensation package:** 




  





 As a vital member of the team and in return for your expertise, inclusive approach and commitment, you'll enjoy a favourable salary and the chance to join a passionate and welcoming team.
 



  





  





  





*Here at Skillsearch, we're a recruitment company. In the simplest form, this means we place people at new companies - but it's so much more than that. For the past 30 years, we've been busy helping people (like you) with sought after skills find jobs in the Games, Interactive and Enterprise Systems industries all around the globe. Our company comprises a team of dedicated consultants that work across various niche technologies, including Games, Virtual Reality, AR and XR, Workday, Oracle, Peoplesoft, and eCommerce. We are always exploring other cutting-edge markets. Follow us to see a few of the jobs we're working on, find out which events you can see us at, and keep up with news in the technology, gaming and interactive world. Welcome to Skillsearch!*

title: CloudOps Engineer
description:
**Uppdragsbeskrivning:**
 Wise IT söker en erfaren och driven CloudOps Engineer till vår kunds IT-avdelning. Kunden är en ledande aktör inom modeindustrin med global närvaro, känd för sina innovativa och kreativa kollektioner. Rollen innebär att hantera och arbeta med förändringar inom alla aspekter av en modern IT-miljö inklusive servrar, lagring, nätverk och molntjänster för att säkerställa effektiv och säker drift.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter:**
* Hantera och övervaka hybrid- och molninfrastruktur
* Delta i incident-, problem- och förändringshantering
* Automatisera och strömlinjeforma operativa processer
* Säkerställa säkerhetskompatibilitet och hotsskydd för alla servrar och arbetsbelastningar
* Samarbeta med NOC och SOC för kundsupport och produktionsärenden


**Kompetenskrav:**
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet inom IT-operationer eller relaterade områden
* Avancerad kunskap om hybridmoln och relaterade IT-infrastrukturtjänster
* Erfarenhet av O365-administration, Active Directory, Azure AD och olika säkerhetstjänster
* Kunskap om automationsverktyg och skriptning (PowerShell)
* Microsoft Azure och Microsoft SQL Server
* Erfarenhet av ITSM-processer och verktyg
* Stark kommunikationsförmåga, proaktiv och lösningsorienterad
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


**Omfattning:** 
 100%
   

  

**Språk:** 
 Svenska & Engelska
   

  

**Vänligen ansök snarast med:**
* Ditt uppdaterade CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* En kort motivering varför du är lämplig för uppdraget


 Skicka din ansökan till Wise IT så snart som möjligt för att bli en del av ett engagerat team som arbetar med spännande och utmanande IT-projekt.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
**Important note:** 
 Please remember to include your grade transcript along with your CV when submitting your application.
   

  

**The team** 
 : Our team consists of 8-10 engineers and is responsible for an application for delivery of optimization services for large financial institutions. We value working with passionate, talented and nice people who have fun together, while pushing ourselves and our systems to improve continuously. Our architecture is clean and modern and based upon patterns like automated testing, modulation, clear boundaries and clear responsibilities, and we believe in continuous and iterative delivery, fail fast, prototyping and continuous feedback from internal and external clients.
   

  

**The impact** 
 : OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade. We keep our eyes on the horizon, always on the lookout for new possibilities and opportunities while staying with our feet on the ground, making sure we deliver rock solid services that our clients rely on for their daily business and success. Our optimization services create distinct positive impacts to client portfolio risk profiles and operational costs. When our services execute, global metrics of systemic risks in the financial markets improve significantly. Long-term value to the client is the most important goal of our team, and your contribution in the form of delivery, improvements and innovations can have a significant impact on the financial system.
   

  

**What’s in it for you** 
 : We strongly believe in individual growth and have long experience in guiding early careers engineers in our modern approach to software production, which includes:
   

  

* Rapid, iterative and phased delivery, backed by automated testing and deployment frameworks.
* Streamlined, autonomous and independent teams, optimized and supported for fast change.
* Clean architecture for maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with the team structures and with clear boundaries and responsibilities.
* Innovative culture with strong focus on exploration and prototyping, where failing fast is a virtue which drives technological and product improvements.


**Software Engineer Position Profile**
 We are seeking a passionate and talented individual to join our innovative and forward-thinking team as a Software Engineer during the summer of 2024. Our company is at the forefront of rapid, iterative, and phased delivery, backed by cutting-edge automated testing and deployment frameworks. We believe in streamlined, autonomous, and independent teams that are optimized and supported for swift adaptability. Our commitment to clean architecture ensures maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with team structures and defined responsibilities.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to the success of our projects using your focus, talent, passion, and grit. We are looking for candidates who hold a Master's degree in Computer Science or have equivalent education or background, and have 3-5 years of relevant work experience. We foster an innovative culture that places a strong emphasis on exploration and prototyping. Here, failing fast is seen as a virtue, propelling technological and product improvements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with cross-functional, autonomous teams for rapid and phased delivery.
* Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility.
* Contribute to an innovative culture through exploration, prototyping, and a willingness to take calculated risks.
* Engage in continuous learning to stay abreast of the latest technologies and industry best practices.


**Qualifications**
* Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent background.
* 3-5 years of relevant experience.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for learning.
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute ideas to a diverse team.


 If you are a tech enthusiast with a thirst for innovation and a desire to contribute to an exciting and fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us as we redefine the boundaries of technology and drive impactful change in the industry.
   

  

**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.
   

  

 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)
   

  

**Job ID:** 
 304786
   

  

**Posted On:** 
 2024-07-08
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Staff Engineer
description:
This is a general track for Staff Engineer or above in any team at Canonical. After the first round of interviews we will establish which teams might be an excellent fit, and progress your application with them.
   

  

 Canonical delivers open source to the world across every class of compute. Canonical Ubuntu is the world's favourite Linux for cloud, desktop and IoT. Our engineering teams work on operating systems, programming languages, applications, devices, infrastructure and services. We work in Golang, Python, C, C++, and Rust for system services, and use React and Flutter on the front end.
   

  

 In our levelling framework, a Staff Engineer is not only an outstanding software architect and coder, they also demonstrate the leadership qualities needed to work across teams and products, enabling others to create outstanding technologies and communities. A Staff Engineer partners with an Engineering Director, who is also code-capable, and together they take responsibility for product outcomes. We hire based on academic results and proven product execution, and we select those with a passion for open-source software, innovation, and cutting-edge technology. In this role, you will make a significant contribution in Canonical's portfolio through high-quality code, technical leadership, team motivation and direction, exceptional design, and crisp documentation.
   

  

 As a Staff Engineer you'll drive the architecture, design and evolution of high-impact open source. Our teams work at every level of the stack. From the kernel and system software at the core of Ubuntu through to major language runtimes and the bleeding-edge of cloud automation and distributed systems, you'll have the opportunity to work on complex but highly rewarding projects. Our teams also build the services which deliver Ubuntu to the world, on cloud, devices, servers and PCs.
   

  

 Additionally, this role will give you the opportunity to engage with the broader open-source community. We're looking for individuals who can help build a thriving community, contribute to a broad range of technologies, and ensure seamless software operations at scale.
   

  

 Location: we have remote opportunities for Staff Engineers in every time zone.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Lead design and architecture of an impactful open source project
* Code in Golang, Rust, Python, C/C++ or Typescript / React
* Collaborate proactively with a globally distributed team
* Mentor, develop and advise colleagues in their career progression
* Display technical leadership in Canonical and our communities
* Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them
* Contribute to technical documentation with the aim to make it the best of its kind
* Work from home with global travel twice annually for company events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in Computer Science or STEM, or a compelling narrative about your alternative path
* Drive and a track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Technical leadership as well as team motivation, direction and pace
* Well-organised, self-starting and able to deliver to schedule
* Professional manner interacting with colleagues, partners, and community
* Deep experience with at least one of Go, Rust, Python or C
* Subject matter expertise in your engineering domain
* Conscientiousness and detail orientation, with a focus on performance
* Professional written and spoken English
* Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Passion, thoughtfulness, and self-motivation
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks each


**Additional Skills That You Might Also Bring**
* Experience with container technologies such as LXD, Docker and Kubernetes
* Experience with highly concurrent, distributed systems
* Experience with embedded systems
* Performance engineering – from kernel to web – benchmarks, optimisation
* Experience with software security – fuzzing, tabletop threat models, analysis, audit
* Experience build systems and toolchains, including for cross-compilation
* Experience with public clouds or OpenStack
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu packaging
* Experience with systems programming or scalable web services
* Deep quality and test engineering
* Web or Flutter front-end experience
* REST and gRPC API experience
* SQL and NoSQL data store expertise
* Experience with public clouds or OpenStack
* Experience with Debian/Ubuntu packaging
* Experience with systems programming or scalable web services


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit globally and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Studio Engineer to leading company in Stockholm!
description:
Here is the opportunity for you with solid experience in mechanical design to take the next step in your career. As a Studio Engineer, you will serve as the vital bridge connecting the engineering and design teams, ensuring seamless collaboration and integration between these two essential disciplines. If you are looking for a workplace where you have the opportunity to truly develop together with inspiring co-workers, this might be your dream job. Apply today!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 Our client is building a new organization and is looking for a Studio Engineer who will play an important role in driving the work and the organization forward. The studio engineer is the link between engineering and design, communicating 3D-data and information (criteria) between the relevant parties. You will be responsible to ensure the best balanced solution, both technically and aesthetically. You will be highly involved in development work throughout all phases, both on a detailed and overall level.
 


  


 Our client will provide you with all the necessary support to excel in the role and train you in areas where you lack expertise. In other words, this is an excellent opportunity to develop your skills and create a standout profile in the market.
 


  


 We hope we have captured your interest in the position and the company. You will learn much more during the recruitment process!
 


  


  

**We offer:**



  

  
* Clear career paths and numerous opportunities to broaden your skills and take on new challenges.
  
* Possibilities to assume internal roles such as mentoring or team leading, with your career growth closely guided by our leadership team
